v11Yp8WGMrebZ-cmaPb2QQ.text: First time at Biagglo's Pizzeria, picked up two large pizza - Veggie for lunch  Great Pizza experience, firstly the size - its massive like NY Pizza with a lot more higher quality dough and toppings. More gourmet kind of pizza.  'It s bit on expensive side, but when I tasted the quality its well priced.   One Pizza is good for three super hungry people, or maybe two and half. - we could not finish the first one, the second one is dinner   If you are around this area, you must try their pizza, its a treat and the service is very courteous  and polite. Heaps better then those national franchise chains

x1wRRCRtBC4a2_9uS36-Uw.text: 3.5stars...  I was craving chicken wings tonight during a Netflix marathon but was too lazy to get out of the house so I turned to yelp for some help.   Chicken wings:  Ordered 30 wings. These wings are so good! Fried and juicy without being too oily. They arrived hot and crispy with sauces on the side.  Garlic knots:  I'd pass on these. We ordered an order of 6 and only finished 1.  Fries:  Nothing special... White pizza slice w/ mushrooms:  Underwhelming to say the least. It tasted as if it was left out all day. The slice was cardboard-like. The cheese reminded me of rubber. I tried reheating it in the oven but it didn't help much.   The chicken wings were absolutely delicious but everything else was disappointing. I have a feeling that the wings may have held up the order which would explain why everything else arrived cold. The order came out to $50 before tip.   Overall, I'm happy with the order.  My cravings for good wings was satisfied and I got to finish an entire season of House of Cards without leaving the house.

CiIYhfD9XsWkl3qT44Zyxw.text: I have been in many places but this is the best place i had ever been from a to z best pizza best customers service and an amazing italian hamdsome owner I recommend this place to anybody wanna have a good bite and atmosphere

Hau5rQE3oS9c0ugozQilbg.text: Biaggio joins Bo from Yi Mei Champion Deli on the list of the absolute nicest owners you could ever meet. People like Biaggio are the precise reason why we need to support our local businesses. Great food. Personal service. Owners who aren't happy until you're happy.  It was New Year's Day and my friend and I were looking for a place to watch the Rose Bowl. I called Biaggio's to make sure they'd be open and he said they'd switch the channel to whatever we wanted to watch.  When we got there, Biaggio somehow recognized me from Yelp. He knew I was the one who ended up backing out of the CMYE. Wow! For someone who claims to not be all that internet-savvy, he sure does keep a finger on the pulse of social media.  Long story short, my friend ordered an Italian Stromboli and I had a Pastrami Stromboli. We didn't realize how huge they would be, so we added some Garlic Knots for good measure. The Garlic Knots were extremely moist and doughy on the inside. And they're huge! But nowhere near as huge as the Strombolis. Even with a 3-hour game, there was no way we'd be able to eat all that food. Oh and yes, the Strombolis were all they were hyped up to be. I personally like the Pastrami over the Italian and my friend concurs. So delicious.  With our Strombolis only half eaten, the food coma was setting in and we decided to leave at half time. Biaggio stops us and says we have some Fried Dough on the way. Um. OK. How can you turn down free food from such a generous man? Of course, the Fried Dough was awesome. It's basically pizza dough topped with butter, cinnamon, and powdered sugar. It smelled really sweet, but it was surprisingly mellow. We had a few pieces and added the rest to our to-go boxes.  It goes without saying that I'll be coming back. I need to try the Chicken Wings that everyone is raving about. Also, when I mentioned that my boss loves pastrami, he offered to send us a Pastrami Stromboli when I return to work on Monday. Now that is the epitome of generosity! (I'll be sure to supplement that with my own order of Chicken Wings).  5 stars

VwqpEA4mQa4Saq1tFIbwFg.text: My husband works near here so I yelped to find a pizza place we could try on his lunch break.  My search led me to Biaggio's and I'm thrilled that it did!    The restaurant is not big but it has a nice, inviting feel to it.  Big booths and comfortable seating.  The display case showcases pizza pies, specialty slices, drinks, and their Boar's Head products (hubby's favorite).    It was the owner, Biaggio himself, who greeted us with a smile and a, "thanks for stopping in."  This was just our first taste of the excellent service we received.    We chose a booth and received drinks immediately.  My husband was between a meatball hero and the Secret BLT that he had seen on the website.  He ultimately went with the BLT, we ordered garlic knots, and a small cheese pie.    It took a little while for our food to arrive, but worth the short wait!  The garlic knots were perfectly soft with a crisp and the marinara sauce was delicious.  My husband LOVED his BLT.  The pizza was very satisfying... and you all know by now that I'm a NY'er and my pizza standards are high.  I'm also not losing my touch for recognizing a good slice.  The crust was fantastic - it was crispy and crunchy but foldable and, to some NY'ers, if you can't comfortably fold it it's a total deal breaker.  Oh!  And I almost forgot to mention the zeppoles.  Now, they're not as light and fluffy as I remember them back at my stomping grounds.   But they are deliciously smothered in powdered sugar and served with a raspberry dipping sauce as well as a vanilla(?) sauce that creates a delightfully sweet raspberries and cream dip.  Biaggio took the time to tell us the best way to dip (first in the raspberry and then in the creamy vanilla dip) and this combo was delectable.  My husband preferred to eat them without the dip but he's not a "sweets" person.    I can't speak on the taste of this, but I noticed that they offer gluten free options, and I know this is often hard to come by.    The owner came by to check on us a couple of times with a very delightful and friendly demeanor.  I felt like an old friend of the restaurant, not a first-time customer.  My husband told the owner that he was initially between the BLT and the meatball hero, which he had surmised was the best around based solely on yelp reviews.  My husband mentioned that he hadn't found a fully satisfying meatball hero since moving here and was looking forward to trying it next time.  Moments later Biaggio returned with a plate in hand and gave my husband a Biaggio's meatball to try.  What a nice gesture and we were so excited to try it.  It was incredible, and I'm not even a meatball person.    Delivery in the valley is tricky.  Not everyone does it and, when they do, you're not sure where they'll deliver to.  Biaggio's delivers ALL OVER the valley.  Want to try it but live in Henderson??  Go for it.  They promise your food will be deliciously hot and fresh when it arrives.    Can't wait to return to you, Biaggio's!  Thank you for the kind and hospitable service and delicious eats.

DNXIxgX9SMeMRx-vNAzpNw.text: I hate to go against the grain, but as a True pizza connoisseur, it would be wrong to hold back on this one. For reference I've traveled to NYC many, many times, I lived in Chicago for awhile, I've spent a month in Italy and pizza is my favorite food on earth. If I know anything, it's pizza!! I have never been as disappointed in a slice as I was here.   I do laugh when I read Vegas yelper complaints about brick oven places having "burnt" pizza. In NYC, many order their pizza extra well done and relish in the beautiful black bubbles that a True NYC pizzeria coal fired oven delivers. The crust here was the most bland tasteless cardboard crust I've ever had. I like crust with flavor and this crust had none. It wasn't chewy, it wasn't crispy, it was just blah.   I thought Metro had the greasiest cheese in town until I tried Biaggio's. I've attached a picture of the disgusting pool of orange that oozed out of every bite. I know some are way into the whole grease thing, but I am not. If you're the type that wants neon orange grease dripping down your arms, this is your place.   In fairness, I did order the lunch special (2 slices and drink for around 5 or 6 bucks), so perhaps the pizza just doesn't reheat well and I should have ordered a fresh pie? Definitely hands down the most tasteless greasy pizza I've ever had (yup, I'm including Sbarro and Little Caesar's in that!). This pizza may be appealing to some, but this isn't anything like the pizza served in NY.

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too much orange grease for me !

p-aF78s4VlXFH5WPr3bUIw.text: Dropping stars for new management....the women behind the counter were not very friendly or welcoming with zero customers in the place and the garlic knots tasted stale and rancid. Biaggio would not be pleased.

9SaMp6YmsP37ATpkCPOfBw.text: Phenomenal! Phenomenal! Absolutely Phenomenal! The food is so delicious; you'll keep coming back for more. So far I had their mouth watering pizza, garlic knots, chicken wings and artichoke salad and it was so worth it. Not only do they have great food but also have Awesome customer service, quality ingredients, kid friendly and clean establishment.   The owner makes you feel right at home. Always pleasant and is very proactive in the community.   If you haven't had the opportunity to go and dine at Biaggio's Pizzeria you definitely should put it on your to do list.

FZxyn9WUdEUTEIz4TdmWpg.text: Ordered takeout. Large half cheese half with toppings, wings.  Food was great. Ready when they said it would be. Wonderful customer service. Quaint spot. Will be going back.

geNkTNcMEm69wjAJrMlf0w.text: It's always hit or miss  sometimes it's so good but others it's horrible and burnt and tonight it was dry and burnt...

boCGQC1U3IFDXXiA8CAuzA.text: Good pizza joint. I enjoyed the pizza dough quite a bit.   Their mix is good.   Ordered a half and half and it was delish. I'd only ask for well-done next time so it can support the artichoke and mushrooms better without the dough getting soft.   If you've never had ricotta and fresh basil to your favorite pizza before, try it!  You'll thank me later.   Also, there is a reason why their zeppolis are priced a bit higher than other joints in town.   Let's just say that no one except for Biaggio's makes Zeppolis with the love, technique, quality kneaded dough...there is a science to making them and following the proper timing of when ingredients are added, how long dough is kneaded and tossed, baked / and fried.   Add patience as a +1. Biaggio's treats every food order like it's made for Mama!  They never slack off or cut corners.    I'm a customer of 5 years...not gonna BS anyone on Yelp.  I'm telling folks out there debating between here and another joint to try Biaggio's...anything on the menu.  Ask for special requests if you call.  They may have certain ingredients or veggies or meats if you don't see them on the menu.   Nice and friendly respectable staff.  The owner has personally delivered to my house on several occasions.  Nothing special about my order.  It reflects the love and passion he invested in his business though.   Looking for a properly reliable and delicious Italian spot intended to remind you what Italian should taste like?  Biaggio's!     Again, I will reiterate about the Zeppolis.  They are plentiful, puffy with a slight crisp.  The dough is so well made that even after two days in the container. They were still so soft and had just the right amount of sweetness!!   I don't know donuts that even hold up that well. And Zeppolis should never taste like donuts people.   Hands down, Biaggio's ties Nico's as the best Italian restaurants in town.  Both make their sauces in house.  Also, Biaggio's offers a dine-in area to chill and have a slice  I enjoy eating it in the restaurant.  Very familial.  Take care everyone.    Devin T.   Signing-off.   Stop scrolling down.

YpdFPcSV6MJSCnMtLjjd6g.text: We were visiting family in Summerlin and found this gem! The pizza was amazing and they do carry gluten-free crust. The salads are fresh and plentiful, 1/2 salad would work as an appetizer for two people.  The staff was super friendly and fast. You can't go wrong here!

fMVJfU6lz69PZWJE9XE45A.text: Been on the go lately or rather just no time for home cooking.  Pressed for time usually and squeezing in quality moments with Nessa.  I rarely see her too...  Life. But as we were waiting for our rolled ice cream that she had to try, I called in a pick up order from this place.  They were just around the corner.  The timing worked out well with standing in line for rolled ice cream.   Browsing menu conveniently available on Yelp; I didn't want just pizza again.  They have Stromboli!  What is that?!  I had no idea but I did the crazy and ordered something I've never tried nor seen!  Trusting the Yelp rating and glad they were close by.  Arrived for pick up and told Ness just show them my Yelp Eat 24 receipt on my cell.  She's like, "WHAT DIDJA ORDERRRR?!"  Hahhaaaa I told her I didn't know and asked why.  Laughing she showed me the box.  We were all daaaaaang!  So its like a pizza sandwich in a sealed off bun.  Comes with a marinara sauce which was too dinky for the meal portion.  We need a can full of marinara for the large stromboli!  Hahahaa.  It was a super delicious surprise.  Yeah I actually ate half of it - almost overdosed.  The filling is really tasty.  What I liked best is it was somewhat easier to eat than a pizza slice while on the road.  Great find on Yelp!

Food: I ordered the meat lover and chicken artichoke pizza(half & half) based on the review I have read and pizza was delicious. One note on the pizza dough, it is not one of those thin pizza dough. It is rather a heavy side and the dough is a bit greasy. Overall pizza tasted great and I personally liked the chicken artichoke pizza. I also ordered medium chicken wings, and it was not your typical chicken wing with sauce all over on it... I liked it because it has taste of dry wings and flavour and taste with medium chicken wings. Worth it to try. I will come back here for sure to try others on the menu.

QMfpKo2YUc2bduuckUZcIg.text: Ok... driving up I didn't have high hopes.  Walking in it was clean but empty and again I  didn't have high hopes.  Give this place a chance!   Turns out it was probably the best Italian American (settabello has my napolitano pizza heart) I have had in Vegas.     Not only was it delicious but we got great service from the owner.   Yes you could say that was because we were the only ones in there but you could tell that he really cared.   And they have gluten free!   I'm definitely coming back!

X8balx8qQ9taEmUowQ-3ng.text: I LOVE this place. For me the thing that makes great pizza is the crust, and their pizza crust is SO good. Thin, crispy, and yummy flavor. The place is always clean and well taken care of and the staff seem to be very happy. The owner Paul is always so friendly and welcoming. I work next door and always make it a point to support this place. Skip the cheepo pizza joints and get some of the good stuff. You'll thank yourself.

o5UhqWmbwCPFq141QpiV-Q.text: I love this little joint. The restaurant is small but it truly makes one of my favorite pizzas in town. They have a pretty diverse menu with unique pizzas. Their price point is also very reasonable and affordable. One of my favorite pizzas are the white pizzas, in particular the art of chicken. The service is also good they try to make you feel as comfortable as possible. So if you are looking for a laid back and tasty pizza this is the place to go!

HHYhDR5FiSjoNYu9bQNb0w.text: Stumbled upon this place at a family members house because they had their pizza for the party. Ended up ordering from here again and still really enjoyed. Our favorite is the Italian stromboli. Staff is always nice too.

5zM_Q8I30ZVNWWGeFa5hQQ.text: I don't enjoy writing negative reviews but I am truly perplexed by all the high ratings for this place. I love pizza and based on the many five star reviews ordered the art of chicken and a pepperoni pineapple. The four of us all agreed it was some of the worst pizza we have ever had. The crust was like frozen take home, the toppings were sparse. We are just visiting here so depending on Yelp reviews for our choices. I would suggest going somewhere else for a good pizza.

wfS08bqaT2J1S3MZLS9b4Q.text: Biaggio's has the best garlic knots I've ever eaten! They were so soft, hot, buttery, and fluffy, melt in yo mouf status. I could eat like two orders of those!   My wife and I shared the White pizza (no racial, that's what it was called) which included mozzarella and ricotta cheese, olive oil, garlic, and we also added pepperoni to it. It was a simple yet tasty pizza, and the ricotta gave it a nice touch.   Also got an order of their wings, and its sauce came on the side which I prefer anyways. The wings were hot and crispy to the touch, and the buffalo sauce was fantastic!  We dined in, and the service was outstanding. We'll definitely be back, especially for those garlic knots!

We tried the large meat lovers pizza ($21.99), garlic knots ($5.99), and fried mushrooms ($5.99) and were not disappointed at all! I didn't get out server's name but he was so kind and welcoming. It was a little of a wait for the food to come out but everything was served hot, delicious, and fresh. Highly recommend if you're in the area! We will definitely be back.

WBVk1WRJt2ruE5rPncCHAw.text: Maybe I've become a pizza snob.... or Grimaldi pizza whore (oh, can I use that on Yelp?)  Okay under aged children turn away, go to mama.  After reading all the hype on Yelp for Biaggio, I was excited and intrigued.  Could there really be a good pizza place so close to my house?  Game on the hubby and I said, we want some good homemade pizza.  We ordered a large pepperoni and pineapple pizza and it sucked.  Two thumbs down, just sucked.  The crust tasted liked Red Rock pizza crust.  The cheese and sauce is nothing special.  Nope, not coming back.  We didn't even eat the leftovers.  hence, the hubby and I will continue to whore ourselves out to Grimaldi or Settebello.  -M2

WKvYOJwsS0my5Nloui2IxQ.text: We went there on Dec 27th and was greated by Biaggio.  He was very friendly and welcomed us into his restaurant.   We told him that we just drove in from Los Angeles and was looking forward the pizza.  We had the Meat Calzone and the pizza with garlic and chicken.  The dough was very nice and all the ingredients were top notch!  My son even told us that he prefered the baked macaroni here then the one at home!  The service was great and we had an incredible meal in a warm atmosphere!  We'll make sure to visit everytime we go to vegas!

Z9-Gd7eCcQ2eJsHSv7r7_g.text: This place was great. The good was very good, I highly recommend the wings :) The staff was very friendly and gracious.  I will be coming back :)

1-UUNHFuEHos3kMXSQ6aGg.text: My pregnant wife was craving for a really good pizza last week. So, she started looking at yelp and saw all the good reviews for Biaggio's... So, we were off to try it out. First, we noticed a very friendly and knowledgeable server (who turned out to be the owner- Biaggio). He told us about the quality of the ingredients and how the secrets of the preparation were handed down from family... The hype was so much :) Happily, the pizza was as good as the hype! It's the freshest, tastiest, and best pizza we've ever had. We can never go back to Pizza Hut, Papa John's or Woodfired Pizza. When it is hot and fresh, it is absolutely delicious. You can tell the quality of the ingredients! We had the Supreme Pizza(yummy)... also tried the Garlic Knots (amazing!!!) and finished it off with his addicting signature dessert (Zeppole)... Can't wait to have it again :)

-lw0BjDvD5ZgHloa0IQkpA.text: Pizza was great.  Service was excellent. Chicken wings were as if the best fried chicken had babies with great Buffalo wings -- YUMMY!  Now, shall we talk Garlic knots?  I am typically not a fan.  But these are welcome to my dinner anytime!  They had bite to them without being rubbery and they were buttery and parmesean-y and, just plain ol' good!  They deliver anywhere in the valley which is a treat cause we live on the opposite side of town and it would be a bummer if we only got to partake on haircut days (salon is across the street). The best part?  the food actually came out looking like it did in the pictures!  Very much looking forward to our next experience with the owner, the staff and, oh yea, the food!

vOdngFOvJVdJfz_n7ELagA.text: Had a Philly Cheesesteak sandwich and a few slices of pepperoni from this place.   Philly Cheesesteak was the best I've ever had.  I'm not kidding.  Even better than the one from Philly.  They caramelize the onions and mushrooms perfectly.  The meat was flavorful and still juicy (hard to do when it's chopped so fine).  The cheese was great and had a nice tang.   Bread could have been crispier on the outside but that's a personal preference.  Have to say...I'm craving one right now. Pepperoni slices were nice too.  This place cooks until the cheese is just melted.  I can see how other people have had underdone pizzas since they don't blast their pies, but mine was perfect.  The crust was a little crispy and chewy.  I'd say the crust at Metro Pizza is still way better.  But that's an almost perfect crust unless you compare that to the really high end pizza places like Mozza in LA.  The pepperoni tasted just like a nice pepperoni you'd get at the store.  Weirdly, the best pepperoni IMO is at Round Table.   Very disappointed they are not open on Sunday.  Either they're religious or they really like their football.  I can't believe the amount of business they're turning away on a Sunday.  But everyone needs a vacation I guess. Highly recommended.  Just don't go on a Sunday!  Their delivery is fast and reliable.

qbOfYzjlmei5QnZxvnSZYg.text: These pizzas taste like the ones I remember having as a kid growing up in NEW YORK -- where "pizzerias" serve "pies" whole or by the slice.  Fuggedabout all the other pizza places and try a slice of Biaggio's.  Remember to pick it up and fold it in half lengthwise -- don't let me catch you using a fork. Mangia!

AvsqAIUusWWJ9cv8rHsS9Q.text: I went to a Tweetup event here last night to benefit Stomach Cancer Relief and my goodness, the food was fit for a king. :-) Biaggio himself is an EXTRAORDINARY gentleman and the desert was AMAZING! :-)

7fAxGxb_yuCFdENNblTWxw.text: Let me start off by saying Biaggio's "IS TO DIE FOR"!!!!!!!!!!!!! I have eaten at Biaggio's several times now i try to go once a week and sometime twice a week, with the whole family and sometimes just hubby and I or with friends for lunch and let me say no matter when i go the food is always GREAT!!!!! The Owner Biaggio is always there to greet you and make you feel welcomed, the young staff he has working for him are polite and hard workers. I have tried the pizza with just cheese or with pepporoni and sausage to the ham and pineapple and it has all been excellent GREAT flavor NOT GREASY (Blair obviously does not know what she is talking about) Very TASTEFUL and never bland tasteing, I love it!!!! The Fried zuchinni is awsome, with ranch or marinara the garlic knott yummy always have to order those too. My hubby had an Antipasto Salad yesterday for lunch and it was amazeing it was huge and the italian dressing is yummy!!!! The chicken parmagean sandwich is great too, there has never been anything there i ordered that i was not extremely happy with. The first time i ever went there biaggio brought us out some meatballs and told us we had to try them the where "To die For" and let me tell you he wasn't lieing they are extremely tasty. Also Biaggio is extremely kind and generous When my kids where playing football he brought out to the field 6 pizzas 3 pep and 3 cheese and donated them to my sons team free of charge clear out at centenial high school and they were delivered still HOT the team totally appreciated it!!!!  So if you want great tasting food Biaggio's is the place to go!!!!! Will continue to support him and his business.

A3Q4tSqcVW1Fg1vp8NZnxw.text: This place is totally amazing. Their food is off the charts good. The white pizza is my favorite but I think that there could be a little more ricotta on it. But that could just be the fatty in me speaking. Regardless, its damn good.

mFC0RT3evc4yHHXDA3G5jg.text: Biaggio the owner of Biaggio's can make a dreary day seem sunny and marvelous.  If you're feeling like no one cares - this is your place!  What about the food?  Let me tell you !  The meatball sandwich is the best one I've had (and I've had many !) End your meal with the zeppole - delicate and velvety !  You won't be sorry.

pVzU3kvftJtlS9OepWR1nA.text: Great neighborhood pizzeria.    It's always starts with crust.  If the crust sucks then the pizza sucks.  This is best crust I've had in Vegas.  Sauce has the right amount of seasoning and the prices are great.  I would definitely be back.  Maybe for a sandwich or stromboli.

Xm0EamLXf4Fs_on_ROJALQ.text: We happened upon this place after searching Yelp while in the area and I'm sure glad we did.  Biaggio was very friendly.  We both ordered a sandwich and cannoli.  The Italian sandwich was amazing and by far one of the best sandwiches I've ever had.  Since neither of us ordered a slice of pizza, Biaggio brought over a slice for us to try while our order was being prepared.  The pizza had great flavor and crispy thin crust...perfect.

Vegas and wanted something quick but good so tryed this pizza place and it was Great we loved the pizza espcially me and Mikey it really did taste like NY pizza and garlic knots were good too.Hubby got their breaded wings and loved them so yea will def be eating here again. : )

W8ZK53OHBNHXy_EfB_ed-Q.text: Not sure who that Cassie C is, but it's not me or my girlfriend. My girlfriend and I eat here all the time and we love it!!! Biaggio is a super nice guy, super friendly. Great pizza!!!!!!! :) We love Biaggio's. Oh and you have to try the garlic knots... they're amazing!!!!!

Ozd4Iv1RexIzfHM0WYQjyA.text: This is the type of neighborhood pizzeria that I remember growing up around in NY - friendly, good service, solid food - in fact - the quality of the food here was superior to most neighborhood pizzerias I have been to in recent days.    Pizza was very good - good medium thickness crust, sweeter sauce and good quality/amount of toppings.  Calzone was excellent - crispy top, and garlicky flavor in addition to the expected fillings.  Again - service from the front counter girl to the kitchen staff was very friendly.

vHvMomkmGlNmKoWh0OpoMw.text: By far the BEST Pizza in Vegas! Mr. Biaggio has a passion for food and it shows in his cooking. Give him a try and you won't be disappointed. Grab a slice, a meatball sub, and a drink and you'll enjoy the best pizzeria in town.

jOdYwIKiRzAE9ygUCW8gYg.text: I really love the food.  The owner is very generous and accommodating.

hXEkwvxtPnA5SaNZ9yDtNg.text: Great food, really enjoyed my time over. the place might be small with not much stuff on the wall but who needs that. I cam for the pizza and loved it,

3vKEoOxlpt-xks4s9iTQdA.text: Mmmmmmeatballs!  Phenomenal. Haven't had a bad thing thus far. It's been about two weeks since my last visit. Maybe it's time to patronize this establishment again.

konqmWADJPMOf9Ab6Q0M7A.text: Actually it's a 3.5. Good quality, authentic to the East coast, crust crispy. Losses .5 because of cost. A small pizza (no matter what they call it) with 1.5 toppings to go north of $18. just isn't worth it.

HWMGL82HT9BaRqW3cDpouQ.text: Food was good but was blown away by how they charge $.99 a wing, I needed up getting g two meatball subs, 6 garlic knots and 30 wings . Total came out to $65.     My only advice is to make sure you really want wings if that's what you order, better off going to wing stop.

DDMj6T1rZbQuwAeHVfwOcQ.text: We were visiting Las Vegas from Utah and wanted to try a good pizza place. We chose Biaggios cause of the good reviews. We were definitely impressed. Food was awesome and the service was even better!

6SuNcF3pt2s_jLdUuj73Bg.text: The food was phenomenal! I had the Meatball Sub lunch special and had the best conversation with the handsome, young man behind the counter. (His head is shaved by choice) I will definitely be back to try the rest of their menu!

u4ikzpJmb7JNkN3b204Uug.text: This place is AMAZZING!! If customer service is important to you you will not be disappointed! The owner is a sweet older gentleman who truly cares about his customers! He took the time to explain his pizza secrets with us! He even thanked our party a couple of times for coming in. He's funny too. Now about the pizza, it was excellent! Best crust ever! I will definitely be back! 10/10

pf0p8v4GsZlXrxB1JJH3Pg.text: I really wanted to give Biaggio a good review but unfortunately, they did not pull through on our large delivery order. I placed this order weeks in advance and come the day of my party the delivery was disorganized.   First off, I was promised that for the price paid, I would receive enough food to feed my party. Plus, I was told that our delivery would be on time. He was 15 minutes late and we had to walk down to meet him near the parking garage to carry all of the food and drinks up to our hotel. By the time we ate our food, the pizza was dry and luke warm. What was the purpose of the delivery fee?   Second, our order incorrect. The salad that he told us would feed enough people ...well...didn't. He said he would send garlic knots...he didn't. They didn't send enough soda liters...and for a group of 13 people, we got 6 forks. This was such a huge disappointment because Biaggo had promised an amazing dining experience.   To make up for it, they offered to send us all of the missing items AND free dessert. THEY NEVER CAME!   My fellow yelpers may say that their pizzeria is good, but I would avoid delivery, especially to the strip and on a big order. It just seems like too much for them to handle.

9I3p_v83ywf_7bqp7NQhEQ.text: Better than Metro, and 1/2 the $!  Okay so I just moved to this area a few weeks ago, so I checked yelp to see where the good places to eat around here are. Saw the reviews, had to find out for myself.  I've been disappointed in the "quality" of good pizza places in Vegas since I moved here 4 years ago. Every place either had bad pizza, or was just too expensive. Biaggio's finally broke that trend. Great pizza, awesome ingredients, and Biaggio himself came over to my table to make sure that everything turned out okay. I got to tell him that I worked at a church, so he told me that if I brought the kids by he would hook us up with a deal. That always means a lot to me when someone runs a great business, and cares about the community!  Only downfall to the place is that it's the chick fil a of pizza places. (not open on Sunday) Also I would probably never go there to watch any sporting event, because of the lack of viewable T.V.'s  Anyway I give it 5 stars. I base that on: quality of the pizza, service/owner, and the garlic knots (you're not getting the whole experience if you don't get them)

RQqxHbGQYjSevQj2BzGT1g.text: Excellent Cesar salad. They also sell pizza by the slice which is great with affordable prices .

EhdRL5lxHyL_0GmCR1eRqQ.text: Wow what an amazing place to eat the food is to die for and Biaggio himself is a fantastic guy! I would have to say that this place is my favorite place to eat while I'm in Vegas. Don't forget to try the zeppole those little donut things are out of this world!

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biaggios Pizzeria

gcKE7mh5Bcg3wgrxx_WUwA.text: Moving here from NY I must say this pizza was just awesome and service equally the same. Best Pizza in Las Vegas!!!

chnM3_wNDoSeDPDnWhvOQA.text: This place was outstanding. The food was great and the service was even better.  Ordered the meat lovers calzone, garlic knots, and some pizza slices.   The Owner actually warned us that we were ordering too much food. No worries - we wanted to try different things. Everything came out quick and delicious. Would highly recommend.

-HRg7Z4EU8zn-y9qf-N2PQ.text: Loved this place. First off, the service was awesome. Mr. Biaggio was so kind to us.  We had a slice of pepperoni and Hawaiian pizza, chicken wings (plain with medium on the side) and a house salad. Everything was soooo delicious. Wings were super crunchy, the pizza was awesome. I would prefer a little More sauce on the pizza and perhaps romaine lettuce instead of iceberg, but that doesn't change the fact that this place is great. I can't even explain how well we were treated. Check them out when you have a chance~

OyfwlD5c6I15F7XXiwNcpg.text: I spent at least an hour trying to find what I thought was the best Pizza/Pasta place that I had previously ordered from the other night, but I couldn't remember the name!!. So I decided to try Biaggio's. Thank god, I forgot the other Pizza place, Biaggio's was phenomenal ..It was delivered hot, right out of the oven hot, my mom who is a "pasta critique" said it was the best pasta,she had ever had, and can't wait to order again. Lot's of flavor. seasoning, Caesar dressing the best.  Order taker easy to order with and made it with a few changes.

RpSgqIGGkOTAlx121xSdTA.text: The owner is wonderful and always courteous. He explains the menu and makes you understand the natural ingredients used in his recipes. Absolutely wonderful and delicious for the price.

6gkgFtnSEh8KgjwiKXX9zw.text: Great local pizza spot! Everything is delicious and freshly made. Friendly family owned business with great service, this is my new pizza spot, I will be returning with friends! :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach and mushroom pizza :)

sc6EEBqZAeO3z017r6YNIQ.text: Best deal in town - 2 New York style slices any toppings (supreme, meat lover, chicken artichoke) and a drink at a cheap price - great value.  You can get one meat lovers and another one supreme etc... Slices cooked perfectly, no drooping when you pick up, most other New York styles I have tried droop.

yPH9u72Xtb-LQcT71TKvgg.text: After trying pizza places all over town we have finally found the freshest, most flavorful pizza in town! The crust is amazing and the toppings are so fresh! Great customer service too. Can't wait to come back. Plus they deliver!!!

wojSavuq3Lb2F6TesWM9HQ.text: Good food. Pizza, wings and salad. Next time Alfredo or Ziti! Great customer service and reasonable prices.

g3sl16RnehpGJTcRsTX5kQ.text: Soooo good.  We ordered cheese pizza...they gave us more than we ordered...it was fantastically delicious.  Two things I would like to see change if possible...it was super cheesy but I'd like a bit more sauce on it and it was very salty.

Ya5xN-22BSCnYlsNhLAtSQ.text: Excellent food, Excellent service! This is our favorite local pizza shop. The owner and family treat you like family, making sure you are completely taken care of. The pizza, salads and garlic knots are just outstanding!

FMU2kh14lqBNCjs7G0DayA.text: We walked in on Sunday night around 9 PM, ordered garlic knots (bombbbb) and an X- Large pizza. While the pizza was mediocre, the owner of the pizzeria is amazing!!! He is extremely kind, and welcoming! Albeit the okay pizza, the garlic knots were very delicious. All in all, I would recommend because of the welcoming energy!

W198lISp8rjguAgBbAfsQA.text: Hands down, the best pizza I've ever had. Amazing customer service ...... we will 1000000% be repeat customers.

uy7MaICIxivKlF1eGBfN8A.text: I was really torn as to how to score this place, so I decided to score the pizza rather than the overall experience.   I was craving pizza one night, and I haven't lived in this side of town for very long. Yelpers seem to love this place, so I tried it out. The pizza was hot and fresh and really fantastic. Just as I like it...not too thick or thin, the perfect amount of sauce, and quality toppings. However, there is only one size, so if you're eating alone and don't want to/can't eat it all yourself, it's a waste. It is also really expensive for a meal for one. If it had been earlier in the evening, I probably would have left without ordering anything, but I was hungry and it was a work night, so I forked out the big bucks and took the leftovers (3/4 pizza) to a friend the next day. Would I go back? Not if I were alone. With friends, maybe.

6ugjL6J1MCLqN6c0sCgYEA.text: By far, one of the best little pizza spots in Nevada! Grade A service, their hospitality was phenomenal!!! Thank you guys so much for accommodating our Saints hockey team, and parents!!! Lots of love and light!

S12n6t5JUG44NxOi738oig.text: Came here real quick before leaving Vegas. They have exceptional New York style pies and some extra crispy wings, if you're into that! This place is going to be a regular visit for me every time I'm back in Vegas.

rOyWspOXkd3Ole0g6T-zjw.text: Placed a pizza order in advanced for a pizza and wine night I was hosting at home. The pizza arrived about 30 mins later than expected and the owner or manager called ahead to let us know which I appreciated. He even discounted our order, I still paid the full price and tipped delivery driver because I understand things like this happened. Everyone loved the pizza, only issue was I asked the pizza to be square cut as there were 20+ people coming and with the normal slices it made it difficult for everyone to share and try the 6 different pizza flavors we ordered. Other than that I would definitely recommend this place and will order again for a night in with the hubby.

6TfSjjedeCNbaK-NII7Hqw.text: The pizza was very bland, lacking any spices. A little bit of garlic or oregano in the sauce would have been nice. Clean place, friendly service.

EGFnhZxIxj0zIX4HOqxdFw.text: Wow what a find. Hole in the wall place with great food and great service! I will be back!! Thank you to the staff for their kindness and speed of food delivery.

B824edmXZHM2lhwHAJ5uYQ.text: Tried this place based on Yelp reviews. Thank you fellow yelpers for leading us here. We went on Sunday, and it was very quiet when we walked in. The gentleman who greeted us was so nice. The place was clean and the pizza was wonderful. Even though he seemed to be doing everything from taking orders, cooking, and serving...he was fast and efficient. I dont mind waiting on or paying for quality. The crust on the pizza was crispy perfection. Seriously, pizza crust seems to be a difficult task to perfect, but it was spot on. In the famous words of Arnold...I'll be back.

cegp8Iz8bofzmwKD9rSwyw.text: This place is OK but be prepared for your order to be substantially wrong. We ordered a chicken Philly cheese steak, got a beef Philly cheese steak. Paid extra $4 for black and green olives in calzone, could find neither. Fries were oily and mushy. Most of what we did get was good but one person had nothing to eat and the food is overpriced considering that you don't get what you order. Won't order from here again. Dinner for two with soda and cheesecake was $67 plus tip. Disappointing!  Manager wrote to apologize and offered to replace sandwich. We'll give them another chance! Appreciate the kind response.

BtkroxZgUra6eMnPWug8kQ.text: Not only was our pizza exceptional, fresh ingredients, delicious dough, sauce, CHEESE...but the lady behind the counter (maybe an owner) asked if my 2 year old daughter would like the same pizza or something else- she of course took one look at the artichokes and said "No, I want that one!", pointing at a picture of pepperoni pizza on the wall. The lady (sorry I didn't get her name) said "Can I warm up a slice of pepperoni for her?" and then she asked my daughter if she wanted some juice too. I offered to pay but she refused, said she remembered when her kids were that young.  They helped me juggle the boxes out to the car when they saw my daughter wanted to be carried.  What an amazing family restaurant.  Definitely our go-to pizza choice!  Already looking forward to our next pizza night!

PH9oCre82FyFW4wwFiva-g.text: My husband and I wee getting our car fixed and this gem was in the same parking lot so we decided to dine here since we had to wait on our car anyways... let me tell you, the food and service was A-M-A-Z-I-N-G. This is definitely the go to spot for us now. Came here two days in a row just to order the chicken wings.  The chicken wings are absolutely my favorite out of the pizza and garlic knots we ate. However, those were delicious, too!  We ended up ordering their lunch special which consists of a drink and two pizza slices of your choice.  We expected the slices to be small, so we each ordered our own special. The pizzas are freaking huge and we could've honestly shared, but at least I brought home leftovers ;P I ordered a slice of the Art of Chicken, my husband ordered a slice of BBQ chicken, and our second slice we both ordered was White Pizza.  I actually tried his BBQ chicken and it was tasty! The BBQ is sweet and I love sweet :P  I ordered the Art of Chicken without olives and it was delicious. I think the roasted tomatoes is what topped it off in deliciousness!  And I love how every slice of their pizza was crunchy. It's thin crusted pizza with crunch. Just the way I love it.  Order the garlic knots, to try. If you love garlic, DO IT. Yummy and fluffy :P Thank you for your service, it was delicious and at a great price of only $30! 2 lunch specials, garlic knots, and 6 wings.

d0F9SObe9M-_LpwtH5nvcQ.text: I just moved to Las Vegas and started searching for the best pizza...so far the best pizza and wings I have found...the crust was perfect not to thin and not to thick and the sausage gave the pizza a hint of spice which was awesome...the wings were amazingly crisp and it was nice they let you add the sauce yourself which didn't make them soggy especially important when I had it delivered...wasn't able to try the zeppoles because the guy taking my order over the phone was honest and said they don't travel well for delivery...so I'll be sure to stop in for a fresh order  Finally stopped in for the zeppoles and they were AWESOME!

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat Lovers w/green peppers and black olives
Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AMAZING

3LQGcPc3lryTn0MslxMJlw.text: Was here on a work trip. Yelp did not disappoint! Everything was delicious! The pizza, salad, even the  ranch. The garlic knots were excellent! Great friendly service!

d3NEcHgs9fzE4-G6ACq6vw.text: Hidden gem in the SW/Summerlin area. Great pizza and garlic knots.  Try the lunch special: 2 big slices and drink for $7.99

1j5_iQdCaniHUFJnjUq4fg.text: One of my favorite places to eat. Staff is outstanding and the owner takes pride in his shop. It shows. I usually order a standard pepperoni and the ingredients are high quality. I sometimes order the gluten free pizza for my family when they are in town and even that's delicious. The only con is that they don't have large  gluten free pizzas, only medium.   Still a 10 out of 10 for me.

X4v1YDvWMt7FihTleXPVSA.text: On my latest outing here I was hankering for my favorite meal, Spaghetti & Meatballs, besides wanting to dive into a superior New York style pizza.  So I didn't refrain from ordering both.  A fine side salad with Italian Dressing got things off to a nice start.  This was then followed by a large portion of Spaghetti & Meatballs, seasoned with onions, and well executed with fine saucy flavoring.  And, the Pepperoni, Mushroom, & Sliced Tomato Pizza with Grande Cheese that immediately followed was suitably saucy and cheesy, and adorned with all fresh and tasty toppings.  Moreover, the perfectly cooked pizza crust was of the thin variety while still allowing for chomping toothsome bites, and individual slices were nice and springy when hand held.  It was a very satisfying dinner, as well as a reheated pizza lunch at home the next day!

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large Mushroom White Pizza
Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large Ham Pizza with Extra Cheese
