kEjGjv_qlMFcHKjjBAdrnQ.text: I've ordered from here a few times now, and it's been consistently amazing. Reminds me of east coast pizza, even the crust is good and I never eat the crust on my pizza!

jb8fzkhqPXzTNIVsr3OZrA.text: I wanted to try this place because of the wonderful reviews I read about it online, and I sure am glad that I did!  My dining companion and I had a hotel on the strip, so we had to drive out a bit to get to this wonderful little pizza shop, but it was well worth it.  As a side note, they do deliver to the strip if that's something that interests you.  It's an $8.00 charge and can take up to an hour to get it to you according to their website.  But if you're looking to get off the strip for a while, it's about a 20-25 minute drive from the strip depending on traffic, but it's also super easy to find even if you don't know the area.  My first impression when I walked into this pizzeria was that it was clean, uncluttered, and that the smell was mouthwateringly amazing.  We were acknowledged right away by the server, even though she was busy.  We were seated very quickly after that.    We ordered the garlic knots to start out with and I must say that they were just as delicious as I'd read they were, though they aren't quite as good the next day, so eat them when they're fresh.  For the pizza we ordered a small "Supreme" and a small "Art of Chicken".   The menu says that small pizzas are 10" with four slices each, but the pizzas we received seemed bigger than that and had more slices than four.  When the check came we looked to see if we'd gotten mediums, but sure enough it had two small pizzas there.  This isn't a complaint; more of an observation.    The pizza was very delicious.  It had a good amount of olive oil (so did the garlic knots), and I think for some people that could put them off, but I thought it was perfect.  The crust was browned nicely and had a slight crisp to the outside, but the inside was nice and chewy.  Both pizzas were fantastic and my only regret is that I couldn't eat more in one sitting or fit in dessert!  Our server was very friendly and service oriented.  She was also very observant and seemed to be very aware of what was going on in the pizzeria.  She boxed the pizza left overs at the table (the pizza makes great leftovers) and made sure we had everything we needed before we left.  We also were happy to meet Biaggio.  He was very friendly and it was obvious to me that he takes great pride in his business and what comes out of his kitchen.  To sum up this review, I would love to get pizza from here again the next time I'm in the area.  Everything was awesome.  The only bad thing I have to say is that I live so far away!  I would definitely order from this pizzeria regularly if it was in my area.

ZgTUj5JZqkukv3aWrYUQ3A.text: Best Pizza in Las Vegas (that I've found so far)  Oddly their 4 cheese pizza is just 4 cheeses- no sauce.  Ordered without Gorgonzola, and with sauce: it's perfection.  I always try the white pizza but don't quite fancy it.   They also have delicious tiramisu although a little on the sweet side (that's usually how it is with premade Ladyfingers but I've no idea of their preparation methodology) Good cheesecake as well.

hBmdeVLOPlNZBWmpUHfTsw.text: Place is Tits.  Super good for deliveries.  Pizza is really good and u can't help but to eat the crust.

pRxI-zWaD0__hMAEpbJ1Ag.text: The food is delish! Their pizzas were far superior to any others I've had here in Vegas. Their chicken wings and garlic knots could both become my new addictions!   Also, the service and customer interaction was perfection, which seems to be a detail that is all too overlooked in life! Biaggio himself is such a wonderful host that he makes you feel like family rather than a customer. Also, they deliver ALL over town, yes ALL over!  I sure hope they open another location near my Southwest home so I not only get the yummy food, but the awesome Biaggio experience!

yxbctZSVfG9lJOaZhHZn_A.text: Oh my....Amo questo luogo! We had a  pepperoni pizza and another with spinach,  feta, & sliced tomatoes.  Both were great.  The sauce, the cheese, the crust....delicious! Also, we've tried the Italian calzone. Huge and heavy! So good.

-Yk6VTGQZTOSLPiClcgMzg.text: AMAZING!!  I went into Biaggio's Pizzeria for the first time about a week ago and picked up a to-go menu.  While I was there, I had to try a piece of pizza and was stunned... it was delicious!  I took half of the piece home and had my son try it.  He was blown away!!  I went back today with my wife and son and we were treated to the BEST pizza, wings, and garlic knots we have had in Las Vegas!!!  Not only was the food incredible but the customer service provided by Biaggio and his staff was second to none!  He made us feel at home and was so passionate in describing to us the way he prepares his fresh food.  It is truly a one-of-a-kind establishment and worth trying... you will not regret your experience!!    We have now found our #1 pizza place in Las Vegas... Thank you Biaggio!!!

9QAIrgdoazYvWw1R0z4HHg.text: This restaurant is a great find! The owner is personable and a great host. The food is out of this world!!! The garlic knots, pizza, and all desserts are to die for :)

N-KrXVIR9lfSW5S3Zdnf1A.text: I stopped by Biaggio's for the first time just before Xmas 2010 based on rave reviews from the girls at Scandals Salon next door.  Mr. Biaggio greeted me like a long lost friend and made me feel comfortable right away.  I ordered a large pepperoni pie to bring home. As soon as I got it out into my car, I couldn't resist taking a bite. WOW!!!! Such great flavor!  I am originally from the east coast and am quite familiar with really good pizza. Let me tell you, Biaggio's is THAT pizza the east coast people have been looking for in Vegas!!  He creates a delicious fold able crust and his sauce has the perfect amount of seasoning. He told me the ingredients he uses, bursting with pride as he described his methods to create his perfect pies.  Mr. Biaggio himself LOVES to give hugs. He is such a sweet, handsome man. I really like how he makes me feel appreciated every time I enter his establishment.  Today he surprised my husband and I with a complimentary order of wings. His wings are to die for! Great, crispy coating on the skin, juicy (not greasy) chicken and good amount of meat! Not just a little one biter either!  Biaggio's Pizza is a gem among pizza places in Vegas. I am so glad to have found him!   We have pizza at least once a week, sometimes we have him deliver to us, sometimes we go to him, for the food AND the conversation Mr. Biaggio provides.  He will also deliver ANYWHERE in town! Thankfully, I am just a stone's throw away!

hP-aupuES5bgajMXbDxUvQ.text: I was a frequent patron for two years and I  have posted positive reviews on Yelp (often at Biaggio's request) and positive reviews on the local gluten free yahoo group as well.  BUT, I have used the delivery service only twice, and BOTH times they messed up my simple order, the second time sending a regular, non-gluten free pizza, which of course I could not eat. I live an hour away, so waiting for another wasn't practical. I decided to give them another chance tonight, but I wanted to speak with Biaggio personally first and let him know about the mistakes on the deliveries and help make sure it didn't happen again. I told him I would be upset if it happened again, and jokingly said I would post a bad review on Yelp if they messed it up. Instead of apologizing, he defended the restaurant saying, "It's just a pizza and people make mistakes. I'm going to decline your order and wish you on your way." Ironically, he was upset that I didn't call and speak to him about the mistakes(at the time), but this is actually what I was just doing and he refused to let us eat there anymore as punishment. Turns out the service isn't that great after all! Fortunately there's no shortage of restaurants in Las Vegas.

pyBMhNSqmNRS_lGSnZV8Ig.text: The Art of Chicken pizza is phenomenal! The veggie salad is also delicious. Cute little spot. We will be back for sure.

TwhPSFdG7b15abhKBtt8Xg.text: Not that I'm a native New Yorker or anything, but I've had my fair share of pies... and I gotta say, this place is really good.  Shared a pizza with meatballs, mushrooms, and ricotta with a couple friends. The meatballs were seasoned perfectly. The pizza wasn't greasy or stale. Another friend had the caesar salad with grilled chicken and TESTIFIED to the awesomeness of it. The dressing was freshly made in the back according to Biaggio himself.  Speaking of, the service here is incredible. Everyone is friendly and helpful. We ordered a medium pizza and they ended up giving us a large because they didn't have any dough prepared for a medium at the moment. Biaggio came and talked to us for a few minutes.  I'm definitely going to be coming back here to try their other menu selections. I think next up is the calzone.

4RbJYm14Nmg-JVeeY9ky7g.text: I guess Las Vegas Natives must have some low standards for Pizza based on the ratings. I ordered a Pepperoni Pizza and Garlic Knots...some people mentioned these being the best they ever had, these were actually the worst I ever had, very dough and bland. The Pizza may have been even worse though, I like some grease on my Pizza, key word some...this pizza was drenched in it, making the Pizza very soggy. The cheese taste was pretty good and I can't complain about the Pepperoni, but the crust was totally uninspiring, very tasteless. I recently moved here so I can't compare it to other local Pizza places, but hoping this is not the par for the course here in Las Vegas.

r4_Of_pjE-BbquKJxMbznw.text: So...my husband and I started a Friday night pizza venture.  Every Friday, we choose a different pizza place in the southwest part of town.  We have a typical order of garlic knots and cheese pizza.  Oh, and you can't forget the Ranch! :)  And, these are the things we rate the place on...lol!  This Friday, we found Biaggios...it was AWESOME!  The owner was there front and center to greet us.  We quickly put in our drink orders and garlic knots.  The owner overheard our server and thought that was all we were ordering, so he told the server to get us 2 slices for us to try.  We quickly said we were ordering a whole pizza, so they got that going for us.  The garlic knots came out and were SO fresh(definitely not sitting in a warmer!)  These were AMAZING...the BEST we'd ever had.  It must have been the butter that they were sitting in that made them mouth-watering!  Next came the pizza.  Again...GREAT!  We got 1/2 cheese 1/2 meat lovers.  My husband could not stop raving about the sliced meatballs, which we were told were an old family recipe.  The crust was perfect---not too thick, not to thin---but perfectly foldable! ;)    We thought we were done when the owner brought us out a sample of their 'Fried Dough' dessert.  These were sinful...covered in powdered sugar w/white chocolate, raspberry and fudge dipping sauces.  DELISH!  While the food was great, the customer service matched it.  The owner and few servers constantly made sure we had what we needed!  We found our pizza match!

atFZCdE5aTfxkjNgWC4g1A.text: We love this place!  The combination pizza is fantastic. You can get two slices of pizza and a drink for $5.99. The owner is the nicest guy ever!  He gave a homeless guy a meal while we were there. Great food!

WXn1T1MOzsYl2TpS_Qbgag.text: Biaggio's is fine Italian food at extremely reasonable prices for the quality. Don't be surprised if Biaggio comes to your table to welcome you into the family.

--G1VuQrYBeQiWg9WVT7Xg.text: First off, I have never written a review for anything on yelp. I wanted to write this review to share my  Biaggio's experience.  My wife and I live in Henderson and we were going to a church meeting in Summerlin. Instead of picking up the pizza's at our typical Henderson pizzerias, we decided to try a place closer to where the meeting was. I got on yelp and found Biaggio's. My wife placed the order online. Our meeting was at 6:30 and we got to Biaggio's at about 6:15.  It turns out they had the order wrong. They only made one pizza and it was the wrong pizza.  We ordered two.  We decided to wait for them to make the two we ordered. We sat down and Biaggio came to the table and immediately offered us drinks on the house. I said no thanks, we are in a hurry.  He then brought out an envelope with a $30 gift card.  We were shocked, this went above and beyond in customer service. A few minutes later, the pizzas we ordered were ready. We went to pay, and he wouldn't let us.  Everything was on the house. Not only did he give us the two pizzas we ordered for free, but also the pizza they mistakingly made, with wings and garlic knots. We couldn't believe it. we have never had better customer service. When we got there we were really annoyed, when we left, it was one of the best restaurant experiences we ever had.  By the way, the food was outstanding. Pizza was great and the garlic knots are out of this world.  Biaggio's is what all restaurants should be - great food and great customer service. We will be back.

d3HIy5iyXcZfhKaNxXrEPw.text: I love this place! We keep going back for more garlic knots and Biaggio's homemade sauce straight from his Aunt Angelina! The environment is very friendly and the customer service is impeccable!   We have tried the sandwiches, pizza's, salads, garlic knots, and best of all---the Stromboli! Everything feels very high quality. :)

C2bFGi_uunl2Jx8bI4EXAQ.text: Quite possibly some of the best pizza out there and their Cannoli, "forget about it".

fPt8YIMQhUBjfQBQKy8_pw.text: Yum! The lunch special of two huge pizza slices was delicious - and at a great price! Friendly and prompt service. I will be back!

c1DuQzElh-e4S2Y6vVaLxg.text: Grabbed two pizzas for take out. Place is kinda small but staff very friendly. I was offered a free drink while I waited which was really nice. Waited maybe 12-15 min. Pretty quick. Had the chicken artichoke pizza which was amazing and a supreme pizza which was great as well. Zeppole for dessert....these were incredible!! Soooooo addictive. Huge order too. Was a bit pricey but for gourmet pizza, it was worth it. I would definitely order again!

n1Rw0SA-ns01dyDo64en6Q.text: We stumbled by this place. Desperately looking for pizza. We enjoyed the supreme. Mostly loved the service.

iBj36Tj9r7na-NPyDK9DcQ.text: This is my very first interview on YELP.. so I am not sure it will stay on the page.. or go to a filter.   Biaggio's Pizzeria on Flamingo/Fort Apache was right next to a salon that I worked in, and this pizzeria is fantastic. I think it's a "little known secret" that no one knows about yet. Even though the owner (Biaggio) has an extensive menu, I always opted to order one of my favorites: "the Art of Chicken". Which is a homemade pizza topped with chicken (of course) (and lots of it), fresh artichokes, amazing roasted tomatoes (that I think makes the pizza so mouth watering), garlic and black olives. My habit of ordering was to get a slice of the Art of Chicken (which is crispy on the bottom; not too think and definitely not thin) and loaded with all of the ingredients above. (With a side of Marinara sauce). Biaggio's chefs are very ample on the portions... and I used to always order that traditional orange soda in a bottle called .. hmmm.. I cannot quite remember.   Oh yes, when I first met Biaggio he told me that his wings were the "best". At the time, I did not believe him. I thought he was using a "sales pitch" on me. So I declined buying any. Well.. because I worked right next to his building, a few feet in my beauty salon next to his restaurant.. he sent over one of his chefs (a few minutes later).. with a full order of deep fried wings... complimentary just for me to try. YOU HAVE TO EAT THEM HOT and right when they are made. He was right!!! These were the best wings I have ever tasted. The skin and the batter was super crunchy and had an amazing taste. The chicken wings and legs themselves.. melted in my mouth.. literally. Not sure if I had chicken that ever did just that. But I only order them when I know I don't have to share. Biaggio simply is the BEST out there.. just like you are in NYC. (Love you Biaggio) (from your favorite flower Rose).

9otOhuFCfaxiQn2KHJ_cZQ.text: Delicious food, clean and simple atmosphere, and perfect customer service. The wings were our favorite, but the chicken artichoke pizza was also amazing! They even had giant soda glasses! Mr. Biaggio is the best, thanks!

nrVGoKB1OUQ-xAZc22izhg.text: I had a wonderful experience at Biaggio's ! The pizza was great, the restaurant was very nice and the customer service was excellent! I highly recommend this place and I'm looking forward going back again:)

HaMG64MTYphWl6MFJs33zQ.text: The owner is soooo nice! I told him I found his pizza place on this app & that I was visiting from Colorado & he just seemed like my favorite uncle happy to welcome me to his home. I loaded up my GF pizza with toppings and I SERIOUSLY COULD NOT STOP EATING IT!! Soooooooo good! I asked if I could have my pizza cooked a bit longer so the crust would be crunchy and the owner's employee asked if it it was  dark enough & if I wanted it cooked longer - how nice! I had it cooked just a bit longer because I had ordered juicy pineapple (and pepperoni & onions & green peppers & ricotta cheese - I told you I made a loaded pizza!!!). I planned on only eating 1/2 and I ate all but a slice and 1/2! What a treat to eat gluten free pizza on vacation!

h4A9t9DVeN1qBvtiHJSiPg.text: Our family has always loved Biaggio's pizza. Tonight after an exhausting day I got a pizza delivered and when I opened the box after brining it inside I tried pulling the slices apart and the cheese had slid together. Could easily have happened at any point and I understand things happen. I called and let them know and Biaggio's said to eat what we could and he would have another sent over. Not only did a fresh pizza arrive but also a gift certificate. Amazing customer service. I was not expecting to get a gift certificate. Great people and great food.

oRSP_DRi0_2FevaAPF0mmA.text: DELICIOUS! ordered delivery..  Philly Cheese Steaks and Zeppole. It was fantastic! Have to remember to order a side of marina for Philly since it didn't come with. the Zeppole arrived hot and with more then expected! Raspberry sauce was amazing too! They will be a must with every order!

HxQqa0YP-SBN-VRwAuw5BQ.text: What can we say about this place? It was "to die for!" We absolutely loved it. We had the Art Of Chicken pizza. It was the best pizza I have had in a long time. And the owner was so awesome! It was like eating at home. If you have a chance to come eat here, I highly recomend it. Thank you for a great experience!!!

nrYUfq23XGIuW5gG25Eyfg.text: This Pizza is great. The Owner is very cool and the atmosphere is fantastic. They have some great Wings and Garlic Knots as well. 5 STARS!

fIam0wbpKZb0B8djym5jrw.text: We went there on June 26 and I have been meaning to write a review.  THE PIZZA IS AMAZING! So so good.  The owner Mr. Biaggio was funny and even gave us ideas of places to eat around the area (mexican food and it was a great recommendation).  The restaurant was clean, we took the pizza to our hotel room and it was amazing cold later that night, and warmed up for breakfast.  A lot of food for a good price and exceptionally tasty.

GrYQEwbCXx42wIkKPSXrPg.text: I wanna know, they do pizza buffet at lunch time. someone knows? google  serach shows do. but seems like not. I call to there, they talking strange.

MGpAxQr1F3WmXVsNK_hj9w.text: We ordered 4 pizzas delivered to our hotel room last Saturday night. 2 regular crust and 2 gluten free crust. The crust on all of the pizzas was so underdone it was gooey and doughy. The slices wouldn't even hold up as you tried to separate a piece from the rest. It was awful. And for $95!!!! I'd have rather eaten nuts from the mini bar. At least they would've been cooked. What a total disappointment. If you're wanting pizza delivery to save some money in LV avoid this place. It's overpriced and bad pizza. You're better off ordering dominos.

qU0Xg48OPhNFBdQwjzWgOw.text: Cute & quaint spot. Delicious pizza served in a friendly atmosphere. I can't wait to try the other items on the menu!

d_JP-KITvNUrFMwaJ4v_pg.text: It's going, it's going.......... IT'S GOOOOOOOOONNNNNNNNNNNNNE! Yet another yelp home run.   Great pizza! Big beautiful boulders of savory sausage. I love the chunks of sausage oh so much and the chunks on our pizza were yum yum yummy and juicy. The sauce was really tasty as well. Savory and slightly sweet. Not too much or too little, the perfect Little Red Riding Hood amount; just right! Good quality cheese blend in just the right amount as well. The pepperoni was spot on as well; leaving just enough orange grease to let you know it's there but not so much it was dripping all over the place.  Bottom-line; not the best pizza I have had in Vegas, that still belongs too Old School, but certainly the second best, with the added bonus that Biaggio"s is 5 minutes from my house and not 45 like Old School.  The antipasto salad was great! Huge! Yummy! Loaded with everything you would want in an antipasto and one thing you wouldn't expect: dill pickle slices. Huh? But when all was said and done, they fit right in.   Only one thing that I would mention on the negative side is that the pick-up order that was supposed to take "20 minutes" took 45. I placed my order on-line, which was easy enough.  Thanks Biaggio's, and thank Yelpers for this place!

IgE7bendsVU0XCTzYUSRTw.text: Great friendly service!  My cheat day was better then expected! It's absolutely a must! Get the white pizza!

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing!

U7e4JZw7-i-Ax90UfFF4jQ.text: Spring Valley's Hidden Gem!  Biaggio's took over a location where our former Favorite Pizza Place was at and we're so Glad they did!  I'm not from New York, I'm not from Chicago, but I Love Pizza and I consider myself a connoisseur. Although I'll try any style and any toppings my favorite style is the Flat, and not the thin crispy kind either. Growing up in the San Francisco Bay Area there was one place that always brings me home and Biaggio's is one of the only three places in Vegas that gives me a taste of the style of Pizza I Loved growing up with.  We tried a Large Pepperoni, Mushroom Sausage and it was Delicious! So delicious my wife and I ate the entire thing, that's how good it was. We ordered Buttered Pasta for our 3 year old and she Loved it too.  But that wasn't the Best part of our Dining Experience, Mr. Biaggio himself came to every table and greeted himself and he also striked up a conversation as well, he was so Friendly and so Concernced, it made you feel so Comfortable to be there it was like you were eating at Home.  Customer Service lacks a lot in today's world and it's Great to see it again. So it's a Double Bonus to get Great Tasting Food and Awesome Customer Service! It's Great to see a Small Business Thrive in today's Economy.

Vo1JHJJvF64hS1Y22yanrg.text: I called ahead to make sure they could handle a HUGE load of deliveries for the Democratic convention happening at the Paris Hotel. They have performed above and beyond the call of duty with 80-plus pizzas and are still pumping them out!! Nothing but great reviews from the more than grateful Bernie Sanders supporters! The next time I am in Vegas, I'm going in for a pizza and hand shakes for the kitchen crew, delivery drivers and staff! Thanks, people! You are so appreciated!

hOI3NsWQdB9R2kyOYm13JA.text: First allow me to say that the THANK YOU for the hospitality to my man Joe!!!  This place puts the words home and family before the word business.  The food is a must!  Just one taste and you too will be a habitual visitor (or like me, stop in whenever you're in Vegas - you'll go home a winner!)

5QsPgcnSLYHneovrUV64yA.text: I am from Brooklyn, New York, and I approve of this Pizzeria. I am very picky with my pizza growing up in NY, although Biaggio's is the best New York Pizza in Vegas, hands down. Mr. B, the owner, has a True passion for pizza and it definitely shows!!

lIB6mRmsbZ1qYSD3Hgzd_Q.text: Dreadful. I ordered it crispy or well done. It was soggy. Gross. About as appetizing as soggy underpants. The cheese and toppings can't even stay on. I think they forgot it was a delivery and let it sit. They also fuck you on the toppings. A buck for six jalepeno slices? A 20 dollar pizza that tastes worse than a 5 dollar shit pizza from little Ceasars. Save your money. The hunt for good pizza in Vegas continues. Just not here.

xfgkCjP15iO_19gvVA5yHQ.text: Amazing!!! I ordered the meat calzone and it was by far the best calzone I have ever had. The dough was light and the ingredients perfect. Can not wait till I can come back for something else on the menu.

w5XSZCUhNc6YzyORWhQkdA.text: The pizza sauce was delicious. Fresh ingredients. Garlic knots and chicken wings are awesome.

lckAk-xr2_5F509KAPT-gg.text: One of my favorite delivery places in town.  I have no idea why, but they literally deliver anywhere in the area.  They know that they are getting good word of mouth through Yelp, seem to know if you are a yelper, and go the extra mile to make sure they get a 5 star review.  I will be honest though, I have not personally ordered pizza for myself from Biaggio's, mainly because I love their chicken wings.  Yes they are lightly breaded, but they give a light crisp and travel well.  They are also smart enough to carry the hot sauce on the side without asking.  My husband however, really loves the pizza, stromboli, and occasionally a calzone.  The calzone sometimes does not travel well, so be forewarned, especially if you order a meat lovers as my husband does.  It can get occasionally greasy.

dhNgy0M93ry5MWcTC7aZrA.text: I tend to get a dozen wings every week with the occasional Slice and HUGE drink combo. The wings are a perfect crisp to oil ratio and even better tossed in their sauce. Try it 1st before you knock it! I love how the owner also treats you as if you're a member of his extended family and asks about your day/evening. I can't even say a bad thing about "Biaggio's" as my food is alway's delivered on time and still hot. I give it 5 *'s all-around and two thumbs up for his great hospitality and humor!

ERxtamV_5jiFb_8XH_7p9w.text: I just came here, last time I was here in July I had a gluten free pizza that was great. Today the price was hyped up! I ordered the same gluten and a supreme. This time the pizza was awful! I highly doubt coming back after this. The pizza was so bad it would tear apart. As the dough was very soft. Same happened with the gluten free. And was also very oily, yuck. Something has changed and I'm not happy as I once was. I left a 4-5 star last time I was here. Also ordered the bread knots and they must have been dunked In butter, the paper bag was soaked and was dripping all over my car seats. Worse experience In pizza ever. These three items cost $55 all around terrible!

YcedpK-oChO1IZaZBHs2IQ.text: Great pizza and super great service.  Will definitely go again next time in Vegas. Young shaved headed great looking guy you treated us like gold, thank you again!

WLEjk8IPUMZZYLIq3aeGag.text: What an awesome little pizzeria in Vegas. My wife and I looked to yelp to help and this gem came up. We ordered the meat lovers Stromboli with a side salad. The blue cheese dressing is so fresh and delicious. The salad was super fresh and the portion was perfect for a side salad enough for two. The Stromboli was fresh and home made . The ricotta was delicious and the sausage was to die for . No skimping on the meat and cheese. The crust was crunchified deliciousness. The owner is a very nice man, very personable . We will definitely be coming back for more . Don't miss out on this place it's affordable and well worth it.

Wm3WN4oKpQsWE0NE9sCisQ.text: Meh...  In town for a conference & ordered because of reviews.  Not impressed.  Decent, but not 5 stars!  Pizza was hot & "tasty", but didn't knock my socks off.  Wings are definitely not worth $1 each...don't order those!!!  I've had better from grocery store freezer section.  Just keeping it real.

F_ODXtmtJX3J9-C56-jB7w.text: AMAZING! Service...Amazing, Hospitality unlike no other...and lets talk about the food....AMAZING! we entered with 7 adults and 12 girls...Biaggio took care of us like we were family. We will definitely be back here to eat and enjoy Biaggio 's company!

p4ta69io9-SlSNiTSO2qHA.text: What is throwing a surprise party without having some delicious eats?... well it's not a party at all. We had been trying to figure out where to order from and then BAM Biaggio himself popped into my head and his words," We will deliver to you no matter where you are." Not to say I doubted the amazing Biaggio but even when I called I said in a hesitant voice will you deliver out by the southpoint and sure enough the very friendly lady on the phone said, "Yes we will". I had also mentioned that Biaggio had given me his card and said to ask for him when I called and he would take great care of us, It just so happened Biaggio was out of town that day but his staff was just as amazing as the time we went into the restaurant.   Before ordering here, I told everyone at the party how amazing this place was and how much love and dedication that goes into the food. Setting the bar high can be setting yourself up for failure in the case of food but Biaggios delivery driver showed up quickly and was very very friendly and when he handed over the boxes of Cheesy amazingness everyone dug in.. From this experience I know for a fact Biaggios picked up at least 5 more customers, especially when I started telling them about the wings and calzones.   Once again Biaggios hammers it out of the park, Thank you and we will be back again.

pxsHYuLD7a8KNLyL2dHl7A.text: This is the perfect pizza place with the best pizza ever.  Located in a beautiful suburb of Las Vegas but so worth the trip.  If you miss rush hour it is only 15 minutes from downtown and worth the trip.  My son had the meat lover's pizza.  A beautiful looking pizza that tastes even better than it looks and that's saying a lot.  The sausage we were told was from a old family recipe as were the meatballs.  You have never had sausage like this sausage. My wife had the white pizza and it was delicious too.  I always have pepperoni and olive which was delicious but I think this menu needs to be explored.  Wish I was a local.   We finished the meal by splitting cheesecake to die for.  The cheesecake alone is worth the trip. If you want to get away from the casinos and tourist food and have some real food in a family restaurant, jump in the car, get away from the casino madness, and enjoy a great meal at Biaggio's.    As we sat there it was clear that they treat everybody that comes in as family.  Don't miss it.

kIh96lbkeL75Rmw_H8Ih7Q.text: Top notch service with delicious pizza and mouthwatering wings. With friendly service, I couldn't ask for a better experience.

rprcXFHDrP3qbbeoYVn0lw.text: You have to love Yelp.  I've lived in Las Vegas for decades, and tried this little neighborhood gem for the first time based on Yelp's reviews.  Biaggio's is about a mile and a half from my residence.  From the outside it looks like so many other mom and pop pizza joints that are sprinkled thoughout the city.  But once you walk in the door, you notice that this restaurant is different.  The place sparkles with pride of ownership, and I was greeted by it's owner with a smile and a handshake when I walked in the door.    A glass display case in at the register displays the samples of food that they offer in a very appealing way, that makes you want to order them all.  There are tables both inside and outside the restaurant, that almost makes the small eating area look large.  The place isn't elaborate, but the tables and chairs are clean and solidly built, and floor looks like you could use the three second rule if food was dropped.  We ordered the chicken wings with blue cheese dressing, and a meatball parm sub.  The wings (10) were crispy, fairly small, and not overly greasy. On a scale of 1 to ten I'd give them a solid 8.  They were filling, tasty, and I'd order them again.  The meatball parm sandwich was good, but not great.  The meatballs were huge, and covered with an abundance of cheese.  On a scale of one to ten, I'd rate them a 7.5.  the roll was toasted, good, but not great.  It was a very filling.  Would I go back there again... A definite yes.  Great food for a football crowd on a Sunday afternoon.  Thanks Yelp for steering me here.

Xyt0r9Kc1n3FYKyEUlaQVA.text: Walked in with elderly Uncle after hearing aids check next door. Uncle is from Philadelphia, pizza and meatball subs are an issue for debate in his family. We had lunch special, 2 slice pizza and meatball sub with drink. Excellent! Uncle was delighted. Clean, great service, had cannoli for dessert, excellent!

3wjXE4DJg_t60mMsKD8NTQ.text: Came here with 3 friends and we all loved it.  I'm not actually much of a pizza guy but you have to try the Garlic Knots!!!  So good I'll go back the next time I'm in Vegas.  Five stars for service!

S96KbDgaP1SpuPivcG1ILQ.text: New to Vegas, I picked this place solely because it was close and convenient. What a great surprise! We just got pizza to go but it was some of the best I've had; hot, fresh ingredients and perfect thin crust. Will definitely be eating here again!

4nvaVKyeMpQl2MEkusuoag.text: You haven't been here yet? What, you don't like pizza?!?! Get down here and try this joint, it's without question the best pizza in town. They fresh make their crust, sauce, sausage and more!!!! This is what's for lunch...or dinner

K9GwPrxhWgF4fhjehGv2yw.text: We have been looking for a  pizza place. Been to several but didn't really cut it. We found this place. Didn't really expect much and boy we were surprised! The food was awesome!!! We had wings and the meat pizza with mushroom and onions. The wings were perfect, crispy on the outside, juicy inside! Sauce was good too. The pizza was the best I've had. We met the owner. Very nice man, great service!!! Oh he makes the metballs and sausage!!! You can taste the flavors of each ingredient, perfectly complemented each other! Gonna be back soon!

MBPIztxRXLF7eCgFY2vXJg.text: It was our first time eating here. All the employees were so nice and made you feel welcome. Very decent pricing and completely worth trying. I would highly recommend this place to others!!!

BdNhQmSTF97pXEtLIUcrQg.text: We've been to Biaggio's twice this week already! Once on Monday and the second time on Thursday, but it's always been to go.  The fiance ordered pizza and wings on Monday. THE WINGS ARE TO DIE FOR! I'm pretty much addicted to their wings and could eat them all the time. The wings are crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside dipped in ranch and hot sauce, its just irresistible. The pizza I thought was good, but nothing like out of this world. We just got the plain pepperoni on one half and mushrooms and sausage on the other half.  Last night we decided to try a stromboli. It was actually bigger than I had thought it was going to be. We went with the Chicken with artichokes and red pepper. I loved the artichokes in it, but other than that I think I would stick with the 6.99 stromboli's vs our specialty stromboli which was 12.99. Both meals ended up around 30 bucks, which seems a lil pricey for some pie and wings. I definitely will be back for the wings though.

JThRJAMuXJkHvxcBU7aHaw.text: I'm not a pizza connoisseur. In New York, I choose to have cupcakes. In Rome, I choose to have gnocchi. You get the idea. My idea of a good pizza is Papa John's with lots of the garlic butter. I just like pizza that tastes good. I honestly don't care or know how authentic any pizza is. On a certain weekday, I had a craving for cheese and marinara and decided to get a pizza.   I came to Biaggio's with a friend and we each ordered 2 slices of pizza. These slices are huge. One slice was actually more than enough for me. I ordered the cheese and Biaggio suggested I get the artichoke and roasted tomato slice. I'm not a fan of artichokes so I wasn't exactly excited but decided to take him up on that suggestion ($6.64 for 2 slices and the largest soft drink I've held in my hand).  The cheese pizza was fine but the other slice with the artichokes and tomatoes was out of this world. It had little pieces of roasted garlic on it that just brought the pizza to the next level.   My friend had the combination pizza and said it was good. She was eyeballing their breakfast pizzas (eggs instead of marinara) and Biaggio was nice enough to give her a slice on the house.   Biaggio is a nice guy that seemed genuinely interested in all his customers (the place was pretty much full during lunch). He is very passionate about his food and business as all the reviews suggest. Do also note  that the place is rather small with a handful of booths so if you're rolling in with a posse you might want to call ahead.  I would like to try some of the other items on the menu (calzones, salads) and this will be my go-to pizza joint when I need a slice. Oh, I'll still be loyal to Papa John's and their garlic butter when I need a whole pie!

MBEPBUZXJ-QEXwM4-3DCzQ.text: Saturday night and the family wanted pizza. We headed over to Biaggio's to see what all the hype was about and it didn't disappoint. We walked in, were greeted by Biaggio (the owner) and his staff and grabbed a seat. We ordered a medium supreme pizza and a slice of cheese pizza for my two year old. While waiting they brought out a complimentary meatball and some bread. The meatball was amazing -- made in-house with a mixture of pork, veal, and some other stuff I don't remember.  The wait for the pizza took a little while and when Biaggio checked on our order he found out that they made a meat lovers pizza by mistake. He came out and apologized and said that he would bring it out so we could munch on it while our correct order was being made. The meat lovers pizza was delicious, filled with house made sausage and bacon. Our supreme came out a short time after and that pizza was equally amazing. One of the best pizza crusts I've ever had. Despite all the cheese and sauce the crust remained crispy. That's something other pizzerias fail at.  They boxed up the pizza we couldn't finish and on our way out they thanked us for coming and said if it wasn't a five-star experience he'd make it one next time. While I don't normally like it when businesses solicit stellar reviews from customers, the food and service was so good that I can't give them anything less than top marks. Now that Ciao Ciao is closed this will no doubt be our go-to pizza joint.

ugWjDf42PFezTKZNwAEQ6g.text: This pizza and the wings are some of the best in town. I can always count on great food and service.

FlgprRStip3Q23O5xwuRHQ.text: Pretty good pizza at an affordable price. I must say this is a pretty good pizzeria in Las Vegas. Came here for dinner thinking it was a sit down restaurant. Although they do have seats here, if I ever came back I would just order the pizza to go (believe they also do delivery). They have pictures of their pizza with each ingredient on the walls and an easy menu to order with. My party ordered an x-large half BBQ chicken half supreme. There was only one employee but service was great. Pizza was delicious. It was thin, soft, not dry, and full of flavor. The x-large was very big, probably can feed about 4-5 adults. Overall, great experience here, wouldn't mind coming back, and definitely worth a try.

Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

smR_zf4bdSlHJ-L7zFFHYA.text: Delicious Garlic Knots, Chicken Fingers, Pizza and Stromboli! Food is great and the service was friendly and quick!

XDUrFbAHBwXvLbk40PGzVw.text: I just had the best Supreme Pizza of my life, delivered within the expected amount of time. Thank you, Biaggio's!

uYhTMaHRQDh5Ni-lX7Ac6A.text: Good supreme pizza and for $21, you get a gigantic pizza that feeds 7 people!! We also ordered the wings and that was a hit!! It was so crunchy and the sauce on the side was perfect. Even my mom loves the food and she's normally not a pizza lover. Good job, Biaggio!

NN2dG5JMfyjlH0BRAxplmg.text: This place was sooooooo good. I read all of the yelp views and thought I have to try it for my self. It was delicious and FANTASTIC SERVICE! will be back for sure. Pizza was amazing  Wings were amazing as well!  Can't wait to try more on the menu!

5AQi3eEmFqxegEIJH00gOA.text: First order on Yelp! delivery! The menu is nice and extensive. You can order wings individually. Lots of nice pizza options. We ordered a cheese pizza, light sauce, side salad, chicken wings, and a Stromboli. The pizza was hot, cheesy, and the taste was good! The wings were cooked perfectly and I appreciate that we didn't get a ton of drumettes. The Stromboli was literally the size of my husbands forearm! It was way too much food for our family and we had leftovers for 3 days. My only disappointment was the salad, but it wasn't a huge deal. It had no flavor and the house Italian dressing had no flavor, so it was like eating an oily, watery moosh. Overall we would definitely give them another try.

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0i-AQhRq9jZ1tUrAiHZLQg.text: Best pizza in the SW area!  There is nothing special to their NY style pies only that they are well made and taste great.  Wonderful crispy, yet chewy crust, great tomato base sauce, good cheese, and high quality toppings.  Not much else you can ask for in a pizza IMO.  Garlic Knots seem to be a staple item in LV pizza joints and theirs are some of the better ones out there as well.  Not as cheap as Domino's, and I don't have anything against their pies really hit the spot when I'm craving them, but worth the price if you are looking for a higher quality pie.

5ywF-UNCplLTbS5aw1ROuw.text: This spot was worth the drive. We wanted a local spot that featured some great New York pizza and yes they got it! We tried the large pepperoni and it has the perfect crust a nice crunch on the outside and chewy inside. The itaoian Calzone was fantastic so full of the perfect flavors. Everyone loved the hand dipped chicken wings.

zXg9FG4gLtonyyDrNnE6Wg.text: First time eating here. Very good! Their ranch dressing is very tasty. Delivered through an app, fast and friendly service.

CxjOo0v1g7Cz-SJY40BJNA.text: If you want not greasy and not heavy pizza, this is the place. Actually I wish they put more veggies when I order Supreme pizza. But above all I don't mind to order again. Cause if you point out the problems they tried to listen. And that's good thing.

0Xo66qW7bgfnGYDHh080_w.text: Their pasta was delicious and the garlic knots are HUGE!  I would definitely go back and the service was great too.

MVJ_qaFy3A6iDh5o-YihLg.text: Love this place! We tried it a few weeks ago & have been back twice. We ate in and ordered take out-both pleasant experiences. Side salad, wings & pizza were all great. Staff is always really nice. I recommend checking this place out or using it as your go-to takeout. (Or both)
