Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside of Biaggio&#39;s. With the menu items on the wall.
Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu for Biaggio&#39;s.

6x8aDisYaQz8qky5xdmDSA.text: Called ahead for pickup and ordered Extra-Large, half Supreme, half BBQ Chicken Pizza.  Restaurant is clean and inviting.

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half Supreme, Half BBQ Chicken

UYbxb89mX6PUyCiCtfgoKw.text: I don't know how I forgot about this little gem!!! I randomly remembered them and went in just for a slice and just as I remember from last time, owner was super sweet and caring. I was dining alone so he kept me company and even offered to take care of my bill! I will definitely be back with my family!

YUk6F00-m1v755eyb-5KDg.text: Good pizza joint. I enjoyed the pizza dough quite a bit. Their mix is good. We ordered a half and half and it was delish. I'd only ask for well.done next time so it can hold up artichoke and mushrooms better. Add ricotta and fresh basil to any pizza and it's heaven! Their zeppolis are delish!! I loved the sauces and eating it in the restaurant hot and fresh makes all the difference.   I'd definitely hit this place up for pizza again.

FWRpmLkLY6SxeVXvBmNDiw.text: First time experience found them on yelp ordered a meat lovers pizza for delivery pizza came on time and piping hot delicious pizza I will order from them again prompt and courteous service

EE0REhyD1g-QNvRZB6o3Aw.text: This is an awesome place for great pizza, wings, salad. The customer service gets a 10 plus. Makes you feel welcome as soon as you walk through the doors. Part of the family!!!!!! Keeps us coming back great job.

EdoKMA1R7zu7pHF5BRhOwg.text: From top to bottom, delivers and exceeds expectations!  It may be a small family owned business but you can tell they take pride in their work and they were efficient.  I place the call 20 minutes ahead of time for a pickup, arrived exactly when they said it would be ready.  I was instantly greeted with a smile by the owner and shown this monster of a stromboli...it was a full 2 ft in length!!  I was not expecting that.  Anyway, drove home, cut into it and took a bite of glory...it tasted like Italy had stepped into my living room.    Definitely check it out!

WeFabqO5lyGBKxOPPoGmNQ.text: Great pizza, crust is perfect, not too thin or thick. Sauce is simple (other place put too much or too little). Staff is always friendly and helpful!

Tueb0aB09XZEaaL3CUmRzw.text: Decent pizza spot in Summerlin. Their pie was good, better than most in Vegas. The staff is friendly and the establishment has always been clean. The only item I was dissapointed in was the Meatball hero (or sub). It was SUPER small. I don't remember exactly how much it was, but I would have paid a little more to have a bigger portion. The owner brags about how his place is similar to an NY joint...the pizza, maybe. But the Meatball hero needs some work. I will definately be back for some pizza.  P.S- VERY strange that a pizza place is closed on Sundays. I worked in about 3 different pizza places, and each one of them Sunday football was the second busiest day of the week. Maybe they should re-consider?

vM_t9Um1xgGsZ8SJSNaeDg.text: Pizza was hit and miss... sometimes it tasted very good, other times it was hard or soggy, but I leave this one star review for 2 reasons.  They both have to do with customer service.   1.  We were delighted to find out that they would deliver to us even though we live way out East.... I also found on their website that it specifically says "We deliver anywhere in the valley!"  So they delivered to us 5 times as there really aren't that many decent options on the East side.  Even though some times they charged $4 for delivery and others they charged $8 we were ok with that and we still tipped generously.  When we tried to order for the 6th time, I was told they would no longer deliver to our  location.  Evidently his drivers are privately employed even though they are still representing his company.    2.  This all probably stemmed from the 5th delivery where we ordered ONLINE over $70 worth of pizzas and calzones for a group.  The total actually came to around $72 (including $4 delivery which the website stated), when the driver arrived he told us the total was $83.  I even had him come inside and showed him the website with the totals.  Well, when the owner called me and informed me that his drivers refused to deliver to us he informed me that the problem was that I was going by the pricing on the website and that was not updated, the extra toppings had gone up by .25 cents each.   Well, I still struggle to see how this is my issue as they need to update their website pricing to reflect their correct amounts or turn off their online ordering.  I was a bit taken back by this interaction because it felt like I was being blamed for the price discrepancy when it had nothing to do with me.  So obviously, all of his drivers got together and decided not to deliver to my house anymore (because it was too far) is what I was told.    Well bottom line is, they need to fix their website if they TRULY are not delivering ANYWHERE in the valley... otherwise, it's clearly just my house that they chose not to deliver to.  Also, they need to update their website to reflect their correct pricing and if it is not correct they need to stand by their prices as it's not the customer's job to know when they raise their prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Website says they deliver anywhere in the Valley even though they now seem to refuse to deliver to the East side.

k9rRirE9V-E_YGkthgUwyw.text: Super greasy, super yummy and super fast delivery. I ordered from here last night for the first time after reading the reviews on here and was not disappointed. I got the grease & carb fix I had been desperately craving.   We ordered a large, Ham & Pineapple plus extra cheese through their online ordering system.   When I ordered it said the extra cheese was $3.50 extra and I didn't really care, but a lady from the pizzeria called me about 5 min. later to apologize and recalculate total as this was an error and extra cheese is the same as other toppings: $1.50. That was nice... I'm sure other places wouldn't have bothered calling or recalculating.  Pizza got to my house in about half an hour on a Friday night and the delivery lady was really nice and smiling. That's always a good thing.   I felt that the pizza could have had more cheese, it seemed like it was a regular amount as opposed to extra like I requested but the quality of the cheese made up for it. I loveeeeed the cheese. I could order a cheese pizza from this place and be happy. The other toppings were tasty as well and felt fresh. Pineapple was juicy, ham was smokey and tender.  Only thing I would change - the pizza crust itself. Too thin! Like paper thin:( I know it's supposed to be NY style but I wish there was an option for a thicker pizza. That would make it a 5 star joint in my opinion. I hope to be able to visit the place in person soon!

36k2o7OIBC9Xpv0pK7uj2g.text: I work nearby and order their lunch special from time to time. 2 slices and a drink for 6 bucks, or 1 slice and 3 garlic knots and a drink for 6 bucks, can't go wrong either way when I feel like cheating on my diet haha. Everyone is really nice too!

4MiIgkXcizSglwiQyVLx1A.text: absolutely the best pizza I've had in the Las Vegas valley. The owner is phenomenal, so personable and made the experience so enjoyable. I will be returning and will always recommend this place for quality pizza and exceptional customer service!

J_yraG1XMw9W1IXJlYS0cw.text: The Supreme pizza is delicious!!! This place is a hidden gem! Can't wait to come back and try their other specialty pizzas.

y4MKI9Gf8y2Yap-7dfr0eA.text: I had a gift certificate so I decided to try this place. SO HAPPY I DID!  WOW!! AMAZING!!  Their specialty pizza with chicken, artichoke hearts, tomatos, and black olives is EXCELLENT! Their garlic knots are beyond yummy and their salads are HUGE and super fresh! The girl who answered the phone was so sweet and very knowledgeable about the menu items. Delivery was within the time they said and the delivery guy was nice. I gave him and extra great tip for the super service! This is now my go-to pizza place!!

tzRAm_J7P60aLRDuRkn8Tw.text: Gluten free pizza!  It's been a few years since I've been able to have pizza out so this is a real treat.  I've tried to make GF pizza at home with some success but I really enjoyed theirs. We got the GF Supreme Pizza which has a thin crust, really good sauce, caramelized onions, mushrooms, pepperoni, sausage and peppers.  Also got it delivered using the online ordering- very easy and seamless, arrived in about an hour.  I am looking forward to trying the other GF dinner options they offer as well.  Husband has Celiac and he didn't get any kind of reaction so I really appreciate that- Thank you Biaggio's!

DEUWLSGbgevlpLDRZCrzVg.text: DICE DEALERS GIVE HONEST REVIEWS................went to biaggios a month ago,got the mush/saus....it was good,but crust was alittle thick,i asked if they make a thinner crust they said yes Last nite had a thin mush/saus.......it was great!...only better pizza i ever had was in rome,italy....everyone is friendly,go give it a shot!

zoUeBRdItX_gcU7CH9hJOQ.text: Enthusiasm is infectious and the owner of Biaggio is not lacking in that. A simple dinner after grabbing a few drinks turned into an educational forum on the process of pizza making and the care put into each item.  For some, this would be considered badgering, but I find it endearing. This man is proud of the product that he showcases, and rightfully so, minus our initial mistake. We had ordered the fries($3.50) to munch on while we waited for our pizza. Poor choice, because the serving was ridiculously small for the price. We had ordered the medium veggie pizza ($16.25) and I was hoping not to regret it. Thank goodness the next dish salvaged my waning interest. The owner came by to tell us some facts about the ingredients. The dough is made without sugar while the sauce does not use sugar or salt. The taste was simple and clean, a way a good pizza should be. The ingredients were fresh and had individual distinct flavors. The crust was magnificent; possessing a crisp snap and browned to perfection. Save room for dessert because the zeppoles ($3.25) are worth holding off for. The mountainous stack of bite sized pieces brought to mind an allusion to fluffy white clouds leading to Mt. Olympus. (Don't judge, Greek and Roman gods are one in the same.) Simply ambrosial with the raspberry and coconut glaze dipping sauces. The combination of both creates a wonderful pina colada taste.   On our way out, the owner told us to take a menu because they deliver all over the valley. Before we could inquire, he emphasized our area. So if you live in the Southwest and don't want to travel, this is an option. Just order enough to cover the trip charge.

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zeppoles ($3.50)
Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium veggie pizza ($16.25)
Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries ($3.50)

DJRD8tPdOr8H19Bx3VrVug.text: It is such a pleasure to be a customer when the owner and staff make you feel wanted and welcome, vs wanting your money!  Each time I call to place a takeaway order and each time I visit makes me smile because I know the other person is smiling too.  The pizza itself is delicious and fresh and boasts a crust that is chewy and crisp (how is that possible?); everything tastes just as good the next day.  Prices are competitive with other pizza joints around town -- a large pizza is $19.99 and is sliced into 8 big pieces -- but you may get MORE for your money here, due to the wonderful customer service included in every order.

okZvLzziRvhhiFTdsXhjJg.text: Great pizza, great experience. super friendly environment. Again great food for the right price.

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stromboli

8sFC55ynDxdKkHWpZl-jyg.text: Is calling someone a Guido still bad when you mean it in a good way?  Sorry to Mr. Biaggio, who was a really nice guy.    His marinara sauce was by far the best I've ever had.  I got the calzone, which was huge, and incredibly good as well.  I'm sure his pizza are great too.  I also wish I was in Vegas more so I can order more stuff at this place.

MJlNDloUBFPCPBqkYcppHw.text: Awesome...sauce, pie, cheese, toppings....love it.  Kicking myself for not trying sooner.  Biaggio has a special sausage recipe that he uses...absolutely killer!

nITTtJOaRaFiEAWZYfyD-A.text: Everything we've ever tried here has been awesomely good.  The garlic knots are to die for - I would go here JUST for those sweet little things.  The calzones are giant, stuffed with yummy ingredients and are always cooked to perfection...probably the best calzones I've ever had.  The crust on the pizza is a good combo of crispy and soft in the middle - it's very good, classic pizza.  Oh, and the meatballs are SO GOOD!  I haven't tried the subs yet, but they're definitely next of my list.  They also get extra points for being willing to deliver anywhere in Vegas.  Mr. Biaggio is so sweet and always accommodating - I don't know why anyone would bother going to a chain or a casino for great pizza/Italian food.  Support the local small businesses!

F4Zt5dP3npcMndjLjnCXoQ.text: This is one of the best places to go to in Vegas, the people there have a great attitude, the food is excellent, and place has awesome service A++++++++ all the way. The owner operator is one of the nicest people you'll ever meet in your life, I highly recommend   this place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The zeppole italian donuts delicious!!
Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half pepperoni half white cheese large pizza

jK8uqjEMiXSOvfJdoJ98xQ.text: Probably the best pizza in the south west. Everything is always fresh, descent amount of cheese, very welcoming service.

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DoQkPIzN3fjJawwwI4ETkA.text: I will never come back to this place. This is my second and last time. I ordered a small order of garlic knots and a large pepperoni pizza. We placed the order at 1:04 PM. It took 30 mins for the knots to come to the table and over 40 mins for us to see the Pizza. Even though the quality might be good, it's unacceptable for a simple pizza to take that long. When I asked what took so long, the answer I received was that the kitchen was busy. By the time I got the food on the table, 2 tables that got there a couple minutes before us already had eaten and paid their bill.

jfMD45mAGOGB-mkOZ74Apw.text: I am not impressed. The pizza, garlic knots, meatballs zeppole were decent, but nothing to write home about.   The worst part was the spaghetti and meatballs dinner I ordered. I asked for sauce on the side, which they did. But they gave me a minuscule portion of spaghetti (not even enough for a child's portion IMO and it was hard and had obviously been sitting. There was literally more sauce than pasta.   The side salad with grilled chicken is $3 more than without, so I assumed they must give a decent sized piece of chicken with it. You know what they say when you assume, right? There was maybe half a cutlet's worth or pre-frozen, microwave grilled chicken (think McDonald's kind) on it.   So all in all, I paid almost $20 ($12 for the spaghetti and $7 for the salad) for what amounts to a child's portion of food (half of which was inedible). We got the food maybe 30 minutes before closing, so when I called to let them know I figured we could just work it out next time (we were happy with everything else) but the phone just rang and rang. We will definitely go somewhere else next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This side salad is $3 more with grilled chicken. See those tiny, Micky D&#39;s looking piece of chicken. That is ALL you get.
Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What is supposed to be an adult portion of spaghetti. It was less than 1/4 of the pan and hard.

tw_Lc2arj5Py2Reli9J5hg.text: The best veggie pizza my wife and I have ever had in Vegas. And the spaghetti with marinara plus meatballs was absolutely delicious.  Would have liked to have rolls or garlic bread with the spaghetti,  couldn't remember if was on the menu.  Regardless, Great tasting food, that's all anyone needs to know about Biaggio's.  Our go to Italian whenever we are in this part of town.

AFdijkO29pzN26k7Tae4wg.text: *BEST PIZZA EVER.*  Hands down! I am a HUGE pizza lover and am more than selective about which pizza places I give my stars to. Biaggio's makes the TOP spot on my list. Their food is made with so much love and they have excellent customer service! The owner comes to personally talk to you and makes sure that you're satisfied with your meal which is almost unnecessary because their pizza is SO good from the tip of the pizza to crust.   Aside from the pizza, you have to try their garlic knots and wings! They are so delicious. The garlic knots are topped off with Parmesan cheese and the wings are so good you could eat them without any dipping sauce.   I don't know why I haven't posted sooner but I was up late, came onto Yelp and saw two reviews from one time customers and had to give my opinion. Biaggio's deserves the FULL five stars. I'm from California and would come back to Vegas just for the experience of eating here! Try it for yourself!

RM-KfudrdSEpXJ2NQY_DBA.text: Delivery Review:  Im gonna be honest idk what most of the reviews here are talking about. I cannot think of any particular reason why the pizza here is anything above just straight average and ultimately forgettable.  Delivery time was fair around 45 minutes. The major benefit of Biaggio's is that it seems to have no location restrictions for delivery. Their location is in West Las Vegas and they are willing to deliver to the strip. That is definitely a plus.   -Meat Lovers Pizza. Okay and nothing greater than that. Toppings, cheese, and sauce were all fine. The crust is definitely not. It is about as bland as it can come.  -White Pizza. Tried to order it with alterations and did not receive any. Again just average white pizza. Not enough garlic. Fairly bland.  It's not worth its own price points at all. It's more expensive than a chain pizza restaurant and definitely not any better. I can only rate pizza delivery in comparison to typical delivery chains. Biaggio's is NOT better than a pizza hut or a domino's. And Im not saying I like either of those chains that much because I don't. But does it justify straying away from the garlic knot stuffed crust at Pizza Hutt? Certainly not. Can it compete with Pizza Rock? Certainly not.  Skip!

z2ATD2tEgKSYkJme6r_bBw.text: Ordered from Biaggio's because they offer gluten free pizza and one person in our group has Celiac's.  Here's how the night went...  "Hey, what should we order for dinner?"  "Let's try Biaggio's, I know they have gluten free pizza." "Cool, we'll get one gluten free and one for the regular folk...who can eat real food."  We called and ordered one gluten free pizza and one large with half "Art of Chicken" and half "White Pizza."  They said it would be about 50-55 minutes.  An hour and ten minutes later, I called to check on the pizza... "Hey, yeah, so it's been over an hour, just checking to see what the deal is..." Pizza guy: "Oh...let me check...ok, 10-15 minutes." Me: "10-15 minutes for it to BE here or for it LEAVE there?" Him: "10-15 minutes." Me: "Ok..."  ...another 30 minutes goes by, we call back again and they're allegedly "on the way."    Pizza finally arrived and as it turns out, they gave us the whole order for free.  Unfortunately, the food was pretty mediocre overall.  I'm giving them two stars for comping the meal.

Sm7psLQyd8hUYWDL8jC-Dg.text: $42 for two large pizzas. One pepperoni, one pepperoni, sausage and mushroom. There was very little sausage and mushroom on the 2nd pizza. In fact there were about three and a half slices with nothing but pepperoni. Overall the taste was average. Overpriced with very little toppings for what I ordered = ripoff!

ZrfxIpd0Ugnmvc2L_GI94w.text: Very delicious pizza. Fast delivery too. I highly recommend this to the rest of community.

jj0FaO3I6GBuWHL3TNiN5g.text: 1st time here. Fabulous pizza!  Some of the best I've had. And the owner (Biaggio) is a very good person, he runs the place with a living touch. The meat lovers pizza was incredible. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8UiMm7ANSivp8OVomhSY6w.text: I don't even think this place deserves two stars... But to be fair to the other places I've rated with one star, this is slightly better. Maybe. Eh. Not really.   So I paid $57 and change for a large pizza with three toppings on half the pizza only (they charge $1 for each topping, even veggies, even if it's only on one half of the pizza. Fantastic...), fries, and some chicken fingers. So the choice of chicken fingers is $8 for three. Three. Or $21 for 10. Got 10 because I couldn't see paying $8 for only three.   Pizza came. The entire bottom of it was wet. Not because of the sauce. Wet like from water or condensation. Nasty. Pizza wasn't great. I was told it was "the best" and as a New Yorker, I'd be impressed. I'm impressed at how bad it was. The sauce was eh. The cheese wasn't good quality... The pizza didn't have a great taste. And it was completely soggy from the wetness. The leftovers weren't even good enough to save and reheat later. I threw it out. I never do that.   Chicken fingers. Thought maybe they'd be good ones--worth $8 for 3. Nope. Regular frozen fingers you can get ANYWHERE. In fact, I can name five places off the top of my head that serve the exact same ones. And none of them cost $8 for THREE fingers. And when you buy fingers, they don't give you ranch. You have to pay $1 extra for each. I told them they can kindly screw themselves. Was about to cancel my order and she said she'd "take care of those" for me. Oh how sweet of you.   The fries were mediocre. Nothing special to write home about. Wasn't worth almost $60 in total. And for the amount I paid for fries, I would have thought we'd get more of them.   Won't go back there. Ever. (This was a delivery order, but still... Either way.)  Wish I could get my money back. But you live and learn.

fy31vedKXgPTttOd77lKng.text: This is a great place to eat and we are sure to stop by whenever we are in town. The garlic knots are fabulous!  The owner is a tall, handsome man who is very friendly and makes you feel like family.

GJlHxaW9UmeKk7mxy9GsQQ.text: Was craving good pizza, decided to try this place based on yelps 4 1/2 star review.     Ordered take out,  small mushroom, garlic, onion,  sausage and 4 wings just to try it out.     Pizza: literally could count each of the toppings on the pizza. Cheap with their toppings!!!  Pizza was ok, not 4 star in my book.  Was not the kind of pizza where you eat the 1st slice and it kept you wanting more.  Tasted a bit doughy, maybe cause there wasn't enough sauce, or toppings.    Wings: was good but wasn't "the bomb" like the person that took my order made it out to be.  Ranch was additional charge.   Did not come with it.  Would I go back...no.  This place is nothing out of the ordinary,  not worth the trip.  Much rather go to Custom Built Pizza where the toppings actually cover the pizza.  They are both ok pizza, but if I had to choose between the two.   Custom Built would be my choice due to the fact that of the generous toppings.  Grimaldi's still have the best tasting pizza.  Just don't like that its so thin.

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheap with their ingredients.
Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Exactly how it looked when I opened the box.  Bad 1st impression.

J7xZHH_kHYf_xEkTAuUL1w.text: Best pizza I've ever had. Everything is great! Fried mushrooms, garlic knots, calzone, pizza, & cheesecake. The owner really makes this place the best. A genuine person! 3rd time coming to eat since I found this place 24 hours ago.  I suggest dinning in to meet the owner and the friendly staff.

okzvA3ZYLgind9h0V9m-lQ.text: Not going to go into too much detail on this one. Have tried it twice. Great customer service, super nice people, just a great atmosphere.   Wings are nothing special, and .99 a piece regardless of order.   Pizza is super greasy, and the sauce tastes much like the bargain brand marinara sauce you can get at Costco. Crust isn't too bad, but a tad bit doughy in places.   Again, only second visit so take with a grain of salt. Just nothing better than the chains and more expensive, so...

7UhzBohkLoiODvDR91zUZg.text: My wife and I shared a Stromboli that we ordered to go.  The service was excellent, the quality of ingredients was above average and we would strongly recommend Biaggio's to anyone.  Often you go to some of those smaller establishments and the food looks good but has no flavor.  I was very happy that wasn't tue here.  Thanks for the good food and timely service.

hWXS_u3-mUK6Gah2GT1jYQ.text: Got this pizza last week. The most delicious pizza I've ever had. Huge and thick crust with lots of sauce- the way I love it. I also got a veggie calzone which was equally as delicious. Most definitely will be back.

STG7KIGO621r-mbMM9V3MQ.text: Amazing food! Started with delicious garlic knots- the best I've ever had. Veggie salad with homemade Italian dressing. Pizza with ricotta, pepperoni, garlic, and mushrooms. Absolutely the best Italian food I've had in Vegas. You know when the ingredients are fresh and quality- the food speaks for itself!! Also have gluten free options: pizza, manicotti, raviolis; ALL made fresh!   Go have some amazing food, service, and wash it down with an ice cold Pepsi. Love this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza!

VPtySQorefVL8kDT8uDGSg.text: Probably one of the better pizza places in town in my opinion... great cheese, good sauce, and a thin cracker like crust. I see alot of complaints about the prices, but consistency and quality cost money, and i dont mind paying extra knowing im getting both every time.

d80IkAMFaKU2C6fqsoLE_g.text: Good pizza and wings. I enjoy thin crust pizza and wings that aren't too saucy. Here the sauce comes on the side. The small was enough to serve two!

hvFRswBFVzUV5moItD-k4Q.text: I wish I could give them more than 5 stars. This is a must go to place. The food is amazing and the service is the best I have EVER had. To see the full review go to my Youtube channel and search "Eatin out in Vegas with Chip" or follow these links.. one link is for the food the other is strictly desserts...YUM!!! youtu.be/3j6UPENs-Cg youtu.be/3gcDqF-Yh5k

jyj3gnoVg7Zt8rJaFbd-8w.text: YAAAAASSS!! This will be our new go to Pizza place! I know some people have complained about the pricing but I really found this place to be quite reasonable plus you get what you pay for. We ordered a large Pizza half veggies and half pepperoni and sausage, a kids pizza (which was really a good size) and a side salad! This fed myself and my husband and two small boys. This slices are nice and big, the crust and toppings are fresh and delicious. The spaghetti sauce taste homemade and the salad was very good!   Unfortunately they don't deliver to where I live but because of  the reviews I decided to pick it up and I'm so glad I did. The gentleman on the phone was very nice and even more pleasant in person.  We will Definitely be going back.

rtXfhcmMxxRg7X2NJzphLQ.text: I rarely write reviews because quite frankly I'm lazy, but i HAD to write this review and tip my hat and give a huge high five to Biaggio's Pizza. We decided to try them on a whim based on others yelp reviews. I downloaded the Slice app and put in an order for delivery. It took about an hour from order to landing on my door step (during peak hours that's pretty impressive). We ordered a large pepperoni, large cheese, baked ziti and a cannoli with delivery and tip the cost was just under $62. The pizza and ziti arrived piping hot and the cannoli cold and fresh. I've got to say as a born and raised Vegas local this has to be in my top 3 best pizza places I have EVER tried! The crust was perfect, the sauce was amazing, toppings were generous and to perfection. The ziti was very tasty, the noodles were al dente and not mushy. The sauce was a perfect marinara and it was very cheesy, just as ziti should be. Now let's get to the Cannoli. Oh my the cannoli. I practically inhaled that delicious treat because it was simply irresistible.  To make a long story short Biaggio's is now our spot. We will be return customers time and again. Any pizza place that has great customers service, great food and delivers has got my business and then some. I will be singing Biaggio's praises to all of my friends and anyone that wants to know where to get some of the best pizza in town. I can't wait to go try these guys in the restaurant.

BEcygSB75QHDg8ux61b1eg.text: Ok so here's the dealio...my 14yo son and I just relocated to the area with no fam or friends so that he can attend a top school in the area. We searched yelp for a great pizza and decided to go here. From the moment the phone was answered to take my take-out order it was easy, kind and just what I was hoping for. Ordered a simple medium pepperoni pizza and Greek salad light in the feta and dressing on the side. OMG YESSSSSS!!! How do you determine a GREAT Pizza?!?!? Well it's the crust, then the sauce...NAILED BOTH!!!! Seriously! Perfect crust perfect sauce perfectly cooked...what?!?! Yes the price is higher than your big box pizza chains but this is the REAL thing! So when you want to go after your cheat meal or comfort food...RIGHT HERE YOU GO!!! And if you want to keep it clean ...the salad was chopped with the right amount of lettuce to ingredient ratio. What more can you ask for?!? No preservatives on that lettuce either...I'm IN!!!  To top it off...as a single mom brand new to the state of Nevada...Paul (owner) was so welcoming, kind and just an all around great person. We will continue to come back and I cannot wait to taste EVERYTHING on his menu!!! Thank you for such a great authentic amazing pizza and best service ever!!!

Jo6WpAvbjFo6ZQ7d6f-FqQ.text: GREAT FOOD AND GREAT PEOPLE !!!! Amazing service with a smile! Can't thank you enough for having some genuine people here !

bef6dAKNR95tyQEHr0a_Fg.text: Stopped in here for dinner tonight after reading reviews on Yelp. The restaurant is located in a strip mall with plenty of parking available.   Upon entering the restaurant, we were greeted by a gentleman who welcomed us to sit anywhere we liked. We immediately ordered a half dozen garlic knots, based on photos we saw on Yelp. We also ordered a large pizza, half Margherita, half Hawaiian. The garlic knots were delicious, and came with plenty of marinara sauce for dipping. The pizza was really good too! Thin crust, with toppings covering the pizza to all the way to the edge.   We were really happy with our experience here. The restaurant and restrooms were clean. The staff was friendly and attentive. Would recommend.

HsYuzKum3BSHzaEHBctb7w.text: We found this place using yelp. I read the reviews and we had to give it a try. We called to place an order to pick up. The guy over the phone was genuinely nice. You can hear it in the tone of his voice. He made our half and half pizza possible since my daughter wanted cheese and my partner and I wanted veggie.  He quoted us 20 minutes and I think we came a little early but it was pretty much done by the time we arrived.  The pizza was hot and just perfect! The veggies especially was really yummy!  I would come back to try more stuff on the menu!

wm9W5CWikoHuibPx0h-hNA.text: Service was amazing, not sure how I feel about the food. I think it was decent. The garlic knots I think were my favorite over the pizza. But again the owner or the person working in the place was very friendly, and very Attentive

jJ6IW0m29BprnVseC9iypA.text: Garlic knots were so soft and perfect, fried zucchini was yummy with ranch, the XL pizza was huge! We split it into two different specialty pizzas; sunrise pizza was my favorite, seasoned tomatoes and garlic with olive oil and cheese. But everyone else loved the meat lovers better; four meats, and not too heavy on cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunrise Pizza

3yW-_oWeNT9wyyMPfPITTg.text: Overly oily, overly cheesy.. As much as I wanted to love it, I couldn't. Pizza usually makes me feel disgusting afterwards and not want to eat it again (for a day), but that post-pizza grimy food coma happened way too early here.  The garlic knots were practically dripping in oil and not in a good way. They were... moist?

wVkdV6si_rul8-7ypevMhQ.text: The staff was very welcoming from the first moment we walked in, with a warm hello & happy to see you kind of greeting! The garlic knots and cannoli were out of this world, and we loved the Caesar Salad dressing. Of course, the homemade pizza had a great balance of cheese to sauce and loads of pepperoni.  This will definitely be our go to pizza place! It's a little tough to find, at the end of the Home Depot parking lot, but well worth the search. Got the cannoli to go, which was still good the next day. Next time, we are going back for the Stromboli!

dgR4EDIMXk3AXqO7tMPZig.text: Love, love, love this place! The owner/manager one of the nicest and most hospitable people I've ever met. And the food... it's one of the best pizzas I've had.

z7xp4tIzLHqiQgu4Tavt6Q.text: In town visiting family and I was craving pasta... they are new to the area also but had been here recently and liked it.  Ok the ambiance is basic but the food and service are top notch.  I wish I had taken some photos but we were all so hungry we just dived right in.  We ordered the fried zucchini, garlic knots and Cesar salad as appetizers.  Everything was great but oh those garlic knots... buttery, warm, garlicky goodness!!  The chicken and eggplant parmigiana were delicious!  The meat lovers pizza was great with a light crust and a perfect balance of meat and sauce.  We went crazy and ordered dessert also and wow!  The Zeppolis.... warm dough balls rolled in powdered sugar dipped in your choice of warm white choc. or raspberry sauce... heaven!  Treat yourself and save room for these bites of deliciousness.  The best part of the night by far was our server Brandon.  Oh my gosh.... so friendly, funny and receptive to our requests.  If I had a business, I would hire him in a minute!  I look forward to coming back on my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The basket of Zeppolis was much fuller but half were devoured before I could take the photo!!
Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple decor but the food is great!

e6U1WjwzF9XA5a3gVca6hg.text: Seriously this place has the best chicken wings I've ever tried! I ordered wings and an xl pizza half meet lovers half art of chicken, both were delicious! Ia so glad I saved this business in the past as one to try because I dont think I'll ever go elsewhere! Totally happy food dance iny house tonight!

r1rIFp76IfIOIRFu9kVyNQ.text: I am a pizza fanatic and I can be picky at times ... but Biaggio's doesn't disappointment! I ordered a large, pepperoni and jalapeno pizza and it was hot and ready on time. I am looking forward to trying the other things on the menu!

PNP7NtHd1IOCjz_6r6a33A.text: Oh man did this place satisfy my PIZZA cravings beyond expectation!  Biaggios is located off of Fort Apache & Flamingo in a little strip mall. A diamond in the rough for sure!   We arrived on a Sunday evening for an early family dinner before some entertainment at Dave N Busters. We normally dine at Dave N Busters but was wanting some good ol' pizza instead. A large party was just leaving as we arrived and we were greeted right away by the nice gentleman cleaning up. He said have a seat anywhere so we did. The football game was on so it was perfect timing.   The menu has your good ol pizza options as well as some appetizers, sandwiches, salads and entree choices. We scanned the menu and asked for some suggestions from the gentleman and we ultimately decided on Fried Zucchini 5/5 and wings 5/5 for appetizer, ceasar salad 5/5 and a Large half half choice with Meat lovers and Art of Chicken pizza 10/5! Is that even possible???? Oh well..... it was that good!!!  The large pizza was approx 16' in size with 8 huge slices!!!! Good thing we didn't order the XL, we still ended up packing up a box with 3 slices left. The Meat lovers had pepperoni, sausage, salami and meatball on it while the Art of chicken had chicken, artichokes, roasted tomato, black olives and garlic. Both options were THE BOMB!  Overall we were super pleased, stuffed and completely satisfied with our selections and meal especially my 5 yr old! We will definitely be back for more! Way better then pizza hut or little caesars! Go get some y'all!!!

u_MuE_DEezyGok_cky2rEQ.text: The pizza was delicious but it's pretty pricey.  I have 3 children so for an individual slice for all 4 of us would of totaled $32 so instead I order the whole pizza which was $46. That's correct approximately $50 for a regular sized pizza. This was a last resort for us but I'll never again pay $50 for a regular pepperoni pizza.   Pizza great, prices not so much.

qToEoHfW41i5iwb5MOVRNA.text: Came in here today before our road trip back home to LA - my hubby and I had a hard time choosing what to eat since everything looked so good ( pizza / salad / pasta) - We ended up with the fried mushrooms and a meatball stromboli- (since we both hadn't had one since our trip to the east coast a few years ago) Let me tell you it did not disappoint! Everything was so DELICIOUS! We literally couldn't wait to eat it and ended up having a portion of the meal in the restaurant - the owner is super friendly and took care of us. Great food, very clean, and a very nice owner - I will definitely be back when I'm back in Vegas and will be recommending it to my friends! I can't wait to try their pizza / salad and zeppoli next time! Do yourself a favor and check this place out - you won't be disappointed!

nBZLCczhL3c7xMLO7Ytl4g.text: We had an absolutely amazing experience here today! The owner was one of the most kind and outgoing people I've ever had serve us. He really made us feel welcome and special from the time we walked in to when we left. Service was phenomenal!   The food was also really good, we went with a half supreme half custom. They're thinner slices which I love! Great fresh ingredients on top to make the taste of the pizza great. We also got the fried dough with powdered sugar and it was so good we ate the whole basket (which had a ton in there). Overall amazing experience and we will definitely be back

-HYHA4bDvVdVMumquxZegg.text: It's not exactly close to the strip but so worth the drive!  A friend of ours who lives in the area took us here for lunch and we are so glad he did. We each ordered the lunch special (2slices and a drink) since we didn't want to have leftovers so we were out and about for the day. We each got to pick what we wanted for a topping on each slice and we had everything from white pizza, plain cheese, pepperoni and meatball. The meatball was mine and it did not disappoint, in fact, it was fantastic! I was already full since we also shared two orders of hot garlic knots dripping in butter before hand I could not finish both slices. The crust, the sauce, the flavor....it's delicious. Pass on the chains and get something a thousand times better at Biaggio's!  The service was excellent and the pizza came out fast and piping hot. The place is small but clean and bright and they do take out and deliver.

34Q4BJ30C3cJ1ISGGRefbw.text: Alright, Biaggio, here's your 5-star review. You said if my experience wasn't five stars, you'd make it five stars, but don't worry--the fact that every person in my family, all of which are particular about everything, especially food, can agree that you have the best pizza in Vegas has earned you all five stars.  I'm a pizza person. As soon as I took my first bite of real New York pizza in Times Square, I was hooked forever and ever and I will eat pizza any day, any time, any occasion, any place. So, you can imagine my withdrawals as I slowly realized that all of the pizza menus were disappearing from the menu stash in my family's pantry--too high of a delivery fee, too greasy, too much broccoli, hard crust--and being replaced with frozen pizzas. FROZEN PIZZA? That's the last resort, not the first! Something had to change.  I had just gotten back from Pittsburgh and it was my birthday. Traditionally, we go out to eat for birthdays, but it was rainy and I was sad that my team lost to the stupid Rangers and I just wanted to stay home and eat pizza and birthday cake. We drove up to Biaggio's based on Yelp reviews and the availability of garlic knots.   As soon as Mom and I stepped in the door, we were greeted by Biaggio. "Are you dining with us?" No, we just want to go home and eat pizza and watch rain fall on our rock backyard. We then had a long chat about which pizzas to get and ended up ordering off the menu--very VIP--and got a "north end" pizza, which is like margherita, but better. It has basil. While Mom and I waited, Biaggio stopped and asked if either us were vegetarians. He brought out a meatball drenched in sauce and a few slices of freshly baked bread, ready for dipping in his signature salt-less, sugar-less and super flavorful tomato sauce. IT IS DELICIOUS. May I have some more, please, sir?  The most impressive part was Biaggio's service guarantee; he really wanted that five-star Yelp review, and he was willing to do whatever he needed to to get it. Okay, we'll see. Where do you deliver? "Anywhere in the valley." ...ANYWHERE!?  The pizza's excellent. The garlic knots are great (I still prefer Metro Pizza's garlic-drenched rolls, but these are perfect for anyone who prefers not to smell like garlic all day.) The service is superior. I don't know how to end this review, so I'm going to go get some more leftover pizza out of the fridge instead.

kXLGLqeVwSfg0InvzbED5g.text: I love pizza!  After reading all of the reviews, my husband and I decided to place an order for delivery today!  We ordered a large pepperoni pizza, half with sausage & pepperoni.  It was delivered within 35 minutes to our house.  (-1 star: $3 delivery fee.)  The crust was a perfect combo of chewy and sturdy and yummy.  The sauce isn't too acidic (my husband gets acid reflux like crazy) and it didn't affect him at all.  We will order from here again, b/c they deliver good quality pizza.  Now excuse me while I go inhale another piece of pizza...  -UPDATE: So I just updated this because after eating the pizza, you feel ok.  Then about 30 minutes later you realize you just ate the greasiest pizza ever and and you want to hurl.  I'll pass next time if someone wants me to eat Biaggio's pizza.

yHWo9GL_Wyojn82ofdblEA.text: A Meatball Sandwich to rule all others!  When I walked in to Biaggios to pick up my order last night, a family was sitting down, enjoying their pizza in the quaint dining area.  A man from the table greeted me, asked if I called in for an order, and stood up to introduce himself.  "Hey, thanks so much, let's have a look," he said as he walked up to the counter with me.  He shook my hand and introduced himself as Biaggio, the owner.  He called to the kitchen to have my order brought up.  He handed me his card and said to call his cell phone if anything wasn't perfect and he would make it so.  We looked at the pizza together to make sure it was up to his standards, which it was!  His daughter was behind the counter helping package up my order.  It felt warm and fuzzy to be surrounded by a True family-run restaurant.  Cheese Pizza -   The NY style, big thin slices of pizza were just like you'd find on the streets of Brooklyn; perfect for folding.  It was cooked masterfully, with just the right amount of crisp.  The crust was warm, inviting, and pleasant much like Biaggio and his family.  My girlfriend loved the pizza, and had no second thoughts.  My only complaint was that I detected a predominant fontina flavor in the cheese, and I'm not a lover of fontina.  It isn't a bad thing, just a personal preference.  The Meatball Sandwich -   AMAZING.  The meatballs were tender, flavorful, and rested perfectly on the fresh baked bread without making it soggy. The marinara sauce was rich and comforting, with the most subtle hint of sweetness.  A heaping blanket of melted mozzarella naps across the sandwhich, flirting with your eyes as you pick it up.  It really is the best meatball sandwich in town, no debate.  Bottom Line:  Good Pizza, GREAT Meatball sandwich, and a warm family running the show makes Biaggios a MUST.

uWunbR4FBZny_e1RyElGQA.text: If I could give this owner a lower star rating I would. Horrible business practices, treats his customers god awful! Support a different pizza shop where the owner is grateful for his customers!!!!!

Lkln93efl14oux0aMcXECg.text: I brought my family back to Biaggio's last night for another taste- since I was craving the meatballs. As expected, we were served tons of fantastic food and the ultimate compliment of the night was that my skinny, picky eater daughter are 3 garlic knots, a slice of pizza, 2 meatballs and a cannoli.  My nephew was a little less than well behaved and still rewarded with a cookie at the finish of his meal :)  The really do treat you and feed you like family. Go there (and get some extra marinara to put it on absolutely anything!)1q

0D_HQCVtXXXGJ5N29peOuQ.text: More people need to come here :) My nephew's birthday was today, and wanted pizza for his birthday. After reviewing pizza places on Yelp, me and my sister decided on this place.  Right when we come in, the owner welcomes us warm and friendly. He talks to our whole group, and makes my nephew the birthday boy feel special. He gave him a donut and a candle, and made his whole crew sing Happy Birthday to him.  The owner knows how to keep his customers happy, he brought out italian cookies, and offered us drinks. I've heard the meatball sub was fabulous, I have yet to try. Everything seems reasonably priced, and reasonably good.

O-DqQE3wqu2kfEBNcAvtMA.text: The pizza was terrible the sauce was sh**, the cheese was gross, and the topics were gross.  The mozzarella sticks were not melted and tasted bad The garlic knots were bland and had dough that seemed microwaved

jukw-lLc95EWNPcHgz6qyg.text: Great local pizzeria!  We were having a hard time trying to find a place to have an end of season party for our soccer team.  Finally came across Biaggio's and gave them a call to see if they could help us out.    The owner and staff were very friendly and more than accommodating.  The food was great - parents and kids alike loved it!  There was more than enough and everything was ready promptly for us.  Thanks, Biaggio's, for a great party for our group!

o6Bs3Qyog7zjP5uwalsp3g.text: Excellent pizza place! We stopped in with some hungry hockey players & the owner set us up! Delicious pizza, pasta & excellent, family-friendly service! You can bring in wine/beer from outside as they don't serve alcohol but totally fine with us doing that. Definitely recommend!

LIh0vQNSEC_OFxnov05MrQ.text: This place is great, a nice little intimate setting and a little bit of outdoor seating. Also they have a wide range of pizza toppings. The food is pretty good as well.

Q4hCbnO0aUEGPU17qP41dg.text: Call me a snob if you want, but having recently moved fro northeast New Jersey to Las Vegas, I wasn't expecting to find great pizza.  And having tried several parlors, I found pretty much what I thought I would, okay but not great pizza.  Then I found Biaggio's ... I'll start by saying the marinara was the best I've ever had.  Tangy, a little sweet and not overly acidic.  The pizza ingredients were fresh and the crust was thin like it should be.  Biaggio's, you're my only pizza place in the wonderful little food mecca of Las Vegas.

gMQEU9otPCPt9XSFSFNTqA.text: I have found my new spot for pizza and wings! Totally worth the drive if you don't live close.   So I have been wanting to try this place for a while but I usually crave pizza on Sunday and go figure they are closed on Sundays.   We ordered the following:   -Meat lover's pizza: they have reg and thin, we got the reg. Ingredients were good, nice ratio of cheese, toppings and crust. Crust was chewy and crispy, it was done right. With all that meat the pizza can get greasy but that's on us not the restaurant.   -Garlic knots: you gotta get this! Knots are in garlic butter with Parmesan on top. I have had it elsewhere and this is the best!  -Bucket of Wings: 40 for 20 bucks, that is a steal and these wings are worth it, nice crunch and subtle spices with sides of Franks red hot, the only way to make real wings.  -Fried mushrooms: I am not a fan of friend mushrooms but people in my group are and they loved it, it was done well.  The prices are competitive, ingredients are quality, service was spot on.    My wife wants to add that they don't' have cannolis...  but I think she will live... Owner said he didn't have the best cannolis so he didn't have any there.

CO_tggEFSUvoVDdlrFgx1Q.text: An excellent pizza parlor with personal attention and moderate prices. The owner check with you at your table, greets you and your family and everybody seems to love him. While we were there, a stylist from a nearby business stopped by and had a salad and some pasta. Always a good sign the neighborhood has him as a pivotal business.

OoPqVbKdDe8HKZ2rb4In9w.text: I decided to stop by a pizza Tweetup after talking with someone who does Biaggio's marketing materials. Biaggio's daughter had been tweeting with me over a week or two. She was excited for me to stop by and try a few dishes. This was the perfect opportunity to do so!  After chatting with Biaggio for a few minutes about his breakfast pizza, several types of pizzas were brought out along with chicken wings, a salad, a huge portion of baked ziti and some fried dough with cinnamon on top. The pizzas brought out were pepperoni, meat lovers, chicken & artichoke and a cheese pizza.  Biaggio mentioned several times that the crust was made to be healthy sans sugar and salt. This is really different and I hope it catches on with pizza makers. The crust did taste good until the last piece.  I tried the cheese, pepperoni, chicken & artichoke pizzas along with some salad, baked ziti, a set of chicken wings with homemade ranch dressing and finished it up with a few small pieces of fried dough covered in cinnamon.  After the Tweetup attendees finished with the pizzas, Biaggio announced it was his son's birthday, who also works at the pizzeria. Biaggio brought out a huge strawberry cake and shared it with everyone. The birthday was a fun surprise that hasn't happened to me at a Tweetup before.  Thanks to everyone at Biaggio's Pizzeria for hosting such a fun event and I even got to eat dinner with the owner and some other cool friends. Even though this pizzeria is many miles away from my home, I'll be back to enjoy pizzas again and again.

3yyQyBD291AWcQe-ErhDkQ.text: Okay, so opinions of good pizza vary from person to person, and opinions of good wings vary from person to person.  I love Biaggio's wings.  Love.  I mean, we will go out of our way to get those delicious wings.  Some people like really wet, soggy wings.  Don't come here if that's what you want.  I like my wings EXACTLY how Biaggio's makes them: smaller and crispy, soft inside, great sauce.  They know how to do it perfectly.  Every time.    The pizza is pretty good too.  They have great sauce and cheese.  The garlic knots are amazing.    I'm giving 5 stars based on everything overall, including service.  Biaggio himself is always there.  He's very involved with the food that goes out.  He's always upbeat and personable, which goes a long way in my book.  My husband and I have been going to his restaurant for a long time now.    It's definitely worth your time to go there.  Great service and food!

_rXk1q27T0zPP-dUUripGQ.text: This pizza is fantastic.  A couple of weeks ago a co-worker brought in a couple pizzas for the team which was working into the night.  Great toppings, very tasty cheese, and most importantly an excellent crust with just the right amount of crispiness and chewiness.  Can't wait to go there again and try more of the menu.

QEoRCPTJRhJ47h2OfStuFA.text: We ate here due to the Yelp reviews.  Excellent experience.  First off, they deliver anywhere in the valley, which will be very nice for us in the northwest.  We ordered an antipasto salad, a supreme large pizza, and an order of garlic knots, and 2 large sodas, which totalled $37.  Excellent price compared to most other independant pizza chains, some of which charge $37 for a large pizza alone almost.  We ate inside, which was available because someone had just finished, but otherwise it was full.  The pizza was very good.  The crust was thick enough to have some chew to it, but still thin.  The ingrediants definitely had a fresh taste to them.  The sausage is home made and very tasty, and the cheese is good.  The cheese does not have a cheap, low budget taste and feel to it.  The pizza had a healthy dosage of toppings as well, with nothing being skimped on, and everything was well balanced.  Our salad was decent, but nothing to write home about.  The antipasto came with a standard assortment of meats, cheese, peppers and such.  It came out in a plastic container, as if it was prepared for delivery.  The lettuce was standard chopped iceberg.  Overall the salad was ok, but not great.  The garlic knots were excellent.  Buttery and garlicky, and thick and chewy.  They were a good size and well priced.  Quite tasty.    The owner, Biaggio, as many others have mentioned, was onsite and quite concerned to make sure everyone was enjoying their meal.  The man cares about his food and cares that you like your meal.  He was actively involved in keeping the place clean and spent time talking to all the clients.  He talked with us about his menu a bit, and the restaurant, and asked how we liked each item.  Fortunately for me, after I inquired about the delicious looking cannolis, he treated me to one.  The cannoli was delicious.  The filling was excellent, and had a perfect blend of ricotta and moscarpone, with chocolate chips.  The staff was all friendly as well.  The service overall was top notch.    Overall, I give Biaggio's 5 stars for top notch service, an awesome delivery radius, excellent food, and great prices.  I cannot say it was the best meal I ever had, but overall, it was solid through and through.  When I want pizza again, as long as it is before 9pm (or 10 on Fri/Sat), Biaggios will be delivering.  Also, per Biaggio, if it isn't "hot and fresh when it arrives, you won't pay for it either."  If the food here wasn't great and well priced, that kind of service would still count for a lot in my book.  I guess the fact that it has excellent quality and price as well are just bonuses.

WSNiLhpC2P0DrBgELB2btQ.text: Finally tried Biaggio's the other day and I have to say one of the better pizza places ive tried in Las Vegas. We had the supreme pizza and the garlic knots. Garlic knots were very good! Honestly one of the better garlic knots ive tried! Pizza was also very tasty, the sausage was definitely my highlight! Service was extremely friendly and prompt! If your on the Southwest side, this is the place to go!

70YYLiBbXeoG0huM2e1AJg.text: PHENOMENAL! I would give it as may stars as possible. The service was awesome as was the food, it's not just some little pizza joint, it's simply the best pizza joint in the valley. The owner and his staff should train other restaurants on how to take of their customer's. If your a local and haven't eaten at BIAGGIOS, it should be your next stop! Again I will just say the whole experience was  PHENOMENAL!

mD8T_Z5UGKCXFN951jvyQQ.text: WOW. Amazing and fresh pizza, sandwiches and salads. AND vegetarians/vegans and the gluten-sensitive are in luck too! As they have a gluten-free pie crust (which is to DIE FOR it's sooo delicious) and gluten-free salads too. They will also remove meat items from any pizza to create a veggie option, including removing the cheese for vegans! Talk about customized pizza. And the portions are great big sizes and some items are family recipes...so they're homemade and incredible. And the owner, Biaggio, is just delightful! Spent most of our dinner chattin' it up with him while we were there. :)  I hightly recommend this pizza place. Really one of the best I've found in Vegas. Thanks for the amazing dinner last night!

KFsFprWEbogwonQbefJKUQ.text: Molto bene!!   The Stromboli here will knock your socks off. All you need to know. If you want to enjoy some takeout, a step above pizza, bring home the classier cousin - Stromboli!   I can't explain what makes it so much more delightful than pizza or a calzone but it just is. I have enjoyed the meat lovers 3 times now and impressed others by serving it. One is around $18 and serves 3 - 4 people. Can't beat that!   Biaggios is a cute hole in the wall with around 10 tables. You could dine in if you wanted. The owner is ultra friendly and I've always had excellent service.    Do yourself a favor and try something way better than other pizza takeout.

74QmUNCE3kzNhvMxsSKvvQ.text: Awsome, the "Art of Chicken" Pizza is truly a work of art, the combination of flavors is music to the tastebuds!

photos.caption: Photo of Biaggio's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Art of chicken

XQ2RD-Sp065-YF2B0uUpzQ.text: Ordered pizza and wings for game 7 of Boston-Miami series.  Got a large pizza, half vegetarian and half cheese.  The ingredients were fresh and they did not skimp on the toppings, but the pizza sauce was lacking a bit of flavor and the crust could have been a tat more crispy.  However, the pizza here is better than others in the area.  Kind of sad to say since this place is a pizzeria, but I enjoyed the wings more than the pizza.  The wings were cooked to perfection and were mm mm good.  Overall it was a good dinner.  Would have been better if Boston won but at least I had pizza and wings to console me.

nc2-rvZ3RkOkfRLiz5Nywg.text: Quality ingredients, crafted from family recipes over years of perfection. Not only greay food but great service. Feels like family every time you walk in, I've never had a pizzeria feel like home.

Kb8xHUOZd4piCU_YTW0VJw.text: Hi everyone, I was visiting from Cali for the weekend. Had a chance to try this place, with the Family. Really friendly and great service. We showed up almost around closing with quite a bit of people, but the gentleman was very welcoming. Pizza is really good. Big slices. The chicken wings are a must. One of the best chicken wings I've had(medium buffalo).  We were helped out by a fine young gentlemen which I believe was the owner. Definitely should check this place out. Thank you again, hope you all get to try it. Enjoy!

avAYn-YeDtR7-HghDtWB5w.text: Best pizza in Vegas! I love the crust it's so crispy and they give lot's of toppings! Great prices and great service. Everything is fresh and it's very clean. You must try it, you won't be sorry.

JShItAUAaeXOVAsGUoaMww.text: Holy Stromboli!  Enough said.  Stromboli is awesome.  My wife brought home the Meatball Stromboli.  I didn't get to try it until the next day, reheated, and it was still great if not better than fresh.  I always thought I didn't really like Stromboli until I tried the one at Biaggio's Pizzeria.  Now I'm a believer.

fuQu6LwybPcwq-09Wfzztw.text: I am a pizza nut. Self admitted, I need help, nut. I couldn't believe how hard it is to find pizza in Vegas that suits my taste.   THIS IS IT! Phenomenal, fresh ingredients. Elegant, intricate yet classic flavors. Friendly, impeccable service.   Garlic knots: Sweet, large,  buttery, garlic not overpowering. Served with great marinara, not some tomato sauce affair.  Greek Salad: perfect vinaigrette, feta that was like it was flown in today, crisp, impeccable.  Italian Sub: usually not my cup of tea. I guess I never had a good one before! The wife ordered it, and I almost stole it from her! Unbelievably well dressed and loaded.  The Pizza: Oh, the pizza. HOMEMADE meatball slices. Dough that was the soul of perfection. Not salted to heck and gone  to make you drink more soda. Perfect compliment of flavors.   Zeppole: Never had it before. OMG. The same delicate pizza dough fried, the blanketed in powdered sugar, served with berry dip, then a custard dip. (Did in order as instructed.) Like the best powdered doughnut you've ever had in your life, only fresh and warm. If you hadn't of told me they were fried, I would not have ever guessed that.   Overall, I can totally see why so highly reviewed. We will be back, again and again!  A total value!!! You'll find cheaper. But you'll not find better.

8LXB0ny2wNEYn57h8RMZvA.text: Came here for dinner. Read the reviews and thought we give it a try. Had a supreme pizza. Definnately home made. Very fresh, just maybe too many olives. The marinara sauce had a great taste. My daughter had spaghetti with meatballs, also great taste and portion for the price. Not a 5 star cause that would be a wow, but will be back for sure.

rYfavt0zDNP69ERWdGbvUQ.text: Visiting Las Vegas and went to Biaggio's to try the gluten-free pizza. Had an awful version of it at Sammy's Woodfire Pizza the day before. The owner made a fantastic pizza for us. The crust was thin and crisp, and the sauce, cheese and toppings had wonderful taste and depth of flavor.   The restaurant is clean and inviting, and we enjoyed meeting the owner. Overall a wonderful experience. We plan to be back.

a4RAEDOY0vsqh6ihnDIAuQ.text: Probably one of the most charming, thoughtful and ambitious Restaruant owners I've crossed paths with. The first time I experienced this place I had a shmorgishborg (not leftovers) of food ranging from salad to specialty pizzas.. It might of been of mind over tastebuds that night because I was delighted with just about everything offered. Now with that said, I've come to visit  recently..  16" Meatball pizza: The pizza wasn't as appealing as the first time?.. Thinly sliced meatballs were decent. On the other hand, the dough/crust was on the dry side, very little sauce didn't help, and quite tasteless in fact. The cheese was fine, It wasn't greasy, which I appreciate but a little grease would of helped this pie out. What happened?..  Chicken Wings (mild): These were Great, just like the first time. Crisp skin, juicy inside and had a one of a kind flavor! Went with ranch this time but I remember the bleu cheese was good as well. I couldn't be more pleased But still didn't make up for the pizza.  Overall, the pizza was disappointing this time around. I liked the chicken wings and that I can vouch for. Service friendly and accomodating, place was clean and had a typical pizzeria feel. I didn't feel I got my moneys worth here -  This pizza with one topping ($15.75), chicken wings 10 pieces with one ranch dip ($7.50) and 2 medium fountain sodas ($1.89 x 2 = $3.78) Total = $27.03 (Not including tax and tip). Too many other places around serving better consisent pies to make a repeat visit (maybe for the chicken wings).

C3GcDTzi08r6GKX_nWZM-A.text: Five star food, everything was excellent and the customer service was over the top.  With 15 min notice they handled our baseball team with a great buffet.  Overall great!

g_pdUxeflWd285jQ-6aGWQ.text: What a great little pizzeria!! Their pizza pie was tasty loved the sauce.  I really want to go back and try the garlic knots they looked amazing.

X1U35OrKtuY-H7dzlmDp8g.text: Excellent food and an owner who is a True gentleman who understands the value of being involved in and takes pride in offering only the best...From quality of food to service...A rare jewel in a sea of mediocrity. Keep up the good work !

wjABapd5BEtiKp2zLeab_Q.text: Great food and service. Try the meat lovers pizza, it's amazing!! And the homemade meatballs are so dang good. It's our new family Friday pizza night destination.

bFSAN9lZfSOOwdu4zzycCA.text: The pizza at this place is amazing! Great service, desserts are sinfully delicious (fried dough OMG). Great Greek salad, little pricey but good. Chicken parm was overdone but pretty good. Will definitely eat here again.  Edit! Service from the "manager" not so great. The pizza is to die for though. I wish they had a place in the Bay Area.

yxv2PLC9l6zIOJBMgOV-vg.text: Very good customer service, excellent food. They're bbq chicken pizza is bomb.com

sHbJ6VyNc6bGavl_DPu3Lg.text: I would give it a zero if I could! We wanted to get some pizza before we headed out to the clubs so we ordered in and got it delivered. we ordered 3 pizzas and it was quite expensive so I was expecting some darn good pizza. however it definitely fell short. it was horrible! cold, crust was hard, all the toppings would fall off. everything was just horrible. I don't see what people like about their pizza because dominos tastes better than them!

hdd-pT6sv0cSlAX978fc9g.text: WOW! Super clean restaurant. This food is amazing!!!! We had salads, pizza, Zitti, and fried dough!!!  Each dish seemed better than the one before it.  The owner so obviously cares whether or not the food is to your liking!!  He warmly welcomes you as you come in the door and keeps you laughing while you're eating!!  Wonder if he'd let me move in?

v7CnxOlWsEZnX9U8HbUwgg.text: Biaggio's is simply amazing.  The owner is a wonderful Sicilian master chef.  The food is excellent and reasonably priced.  When you get there have the owner explain how he makes his own sausage, or that wonderful marinara.  You'll know him when you walk in.  He'll be there to greet you with open arms...  Grazie, Biaggio!!

o5ChkiJQ8QxuN-TMteHefw.text: Excellent pizza, garlic knots, fresh fried zuchini w/ ranch... Truly great Italian food. Hidden gem but because of Yelp found and discovered;) We have eaten in & taken out. Food tasted great either way.

58UegLGR7DQjStv7zdz7MA.text: The meat lovers pizza is TO DIE FOR!!  Just a perfect balance of flavor between meats, sauce, & cheese.  The crust is the perfect combo of warm crunchy/chewy.  My husband has searched 35 years to find a pizza as good as he remembers from childhood (that doesn't exist anymore)...& he says this is SOOO much better!!  The customer service is above and beyond the call.  Recently my dad was in ICU while visiting from MN.  My order was "on the house" as we have become regular customers over the last few months and just needed some comfort food in between long stretches in the hospital. DON'T HESITATE. JUST COME HERE FOR A MEAL!! YOU WON'T BE SORRY ;)

UUWkyKHCaNXcvBi-xDzTJA.text: Hands down the best pizza in town. The owner is one of the nicest people I have ever met and treats everyone like family. Will 100% be getting all my pizza and wings from here from now on.

POX4NVTJuUAhg9TNqLvlNg.text: Huge gluten free variety, personable staff, fantastic food. All very homestyle. I left very impressed. A small culinary treasure.

H0peH5x9VCUP1Zib8jvKZg.text: Went in for meatball sub (which was delicious). Talked into 1/2 sub with slice of pizza. Will definitley go bsck when in area

NZmgEaYj9qR_mGEArcKQ2g.text: Some of the best Italian pizza I've ever had in Vegas and good customer service. 5 stars

0JRQYmk2uwVA88EFWqt-mQ.text: Best pizza I've ever had! Hands down best prices for the amazing pizza they serve. Great service and amazing owner who goes above and beyond for his customers!

Mso7lNhm1x12X3Go1fTerA.text: The food here was delicious. The service was outstanding. The Stromboli was cooked to perfection and it tasted like it. There was plenty left over and we can't wait to have more!!

GFeZdVqWz8374wLrYnX5CQ.text: They accidentally delivered me the wrong pizza today (wanted sausage, got pepperoni, no biggie). I called just to let them know and they sent me the sausage pizza, let me keep the pepperoni, and gave me a $20 gift certificate. Wow, much more than I ever expected.   I've never wrote a Yelp review but had to after this excellent customer service. This business is run the right way and their food is delicious. Highly recommended.

q9TmRMzus_JDVNA3xKisjw.text: We drove from Aliante to here because of reviews. I had been asking my bf for 3 weeks to make the drive Bcz of the reviews. Since Ciao Ciao closed we are ruined - only secret pizza in the cosmopolitan has helped w our craving. Pros:  young lady @ register was super nice Ranch dressing was good  Cons:  beeping noise on register Crust has NO taste/texture Food needs garlic Salad lettuce was not fresh Display of cold pizza in glass has u ask is this going to be cooked or do we order fresh No menu board behind register-u hv to read a menu@ register. We waited awhile so ordered a salad Bcz we were starving & then they gave free apps to the booth behind us for waiting wtf!  Bottom line: pricy-& I don't get the other rave reviews- there's 3-4 reviews like mine that are spot on.waste of $$$ & gas

CQv43f6YwC9_YB4zJRAcuw.text: best pizza in vegas!!! never tasted pizza like this before, its not just another pizzeria its very clean and great service! TRY IT!!!

fhKE8wuQTVRSN9Kgb6XypQ.text: Best pizza that I can find in Las Vegas! Coming in from the East Coast I was in search of the perfect Pie and Biaggio's does not disappoint. We tried a few others on the West side and have come full circle. The staff/owner are/is very friendly and I get the impression that they are appreciative of my business. This is now our go to pizzeria.

UXYE8ysGOsQrkEtZTKf4Cg.text: Meatball Stromboli = amazing Marinara sauce = too good Pizza = great  His dad was from Sicily so the homemade recipes are legit. And  just now eating the cold pizza 6 hours later and it's still good.  Thanks Biaggio! You're the man!

eWAjeOtccH99IgcHGRiBFw.text: Still amazing, since my first review I have ordered about 5 times at least. I recommend this place to a friend that is a pizza snob, mind you I know nothing about pizza I mean of course I know the difference between homemade style and Pizza Hut. Anyway my friend is from the east coast he was blown away, he told me i was spot on. Great place worth the money, it tastes like heaven.

6f24107O0XseF7qr13In5g.text: Definitely the best place for pizza. They have great customer service and the owner is young handsome and shaved.  A must try place.

2KP_ei5lwG_S57Ssgxa-ZQ.text: I grew up in NY and I grew up eating pizza. Stellar pizza, excellent pizza, average pizza, meh pizza, substandard pizza, and downright crappy pizza.  In my many years I've never had pizza quite like the offerings from Biaggio's. We ordered two pies after a long day where neither of us wanted to cook. With happy thoughts of the five star reviews dancing in my head my husband called in the order.   With bated breath I awaited the moment when I would have a plateful of NY-style pizza. For $40. what we got was under-cooked, gooey dough with sauce that tasted like it came out of a cafeteria-sized vat. The cheese to sauce ratio was overwhelming, the sausage on my husband's pizza tasted like overcooked, chewy, slightly burnt, and gummy leather.   The zeppoles came with a white dipping sauce that smelled and tasted like suntan lotion.  I'm Italian and a baker, so my solution is to make my own crust, my own sauce, and make a bunch of pizzas to freeze, so they're ready heat up with fresh mozzarella and basil when the mood strikes. Biaggio's does not rate a second chance with us.   To summarize - if you have a fetish for institutional grade sauce, under-cooked pizza dough, with burnt toppings Biaggio's is definitely for you.  *** 8-20-15 - editing to add that after calling the establishment about the rawness of the dough we were informed that the dough arrives "frozen" so it must have been cooked though.  Biaggio's claims on their homepage that "Biaggio's uses only the freshest, high quality ingredients. Because our ingredients are so fresh..."   Frozen ingredients being passed off as fresh is a reprehensible act by this pizzeria, not to mention a blatant lie.

p1d0Oy9T0rc2_sCS34BlHw.text: Ordered carryout online excellent service, in and out, and the calzones and strombolis are totally delish

4JcAOGYDidULdyqlIkiQqg.text: Great small pizza place. Loved the Greek salad.  Good crust and sauce. Big portioned pizza. Good value.  Very good service

S8YZWkjRqyr6EfV5NgLPkg.text: Erica, the concierge at The Signature at MGM Grand, recommended this amazing pizzeria for us to try.  Absolutely delicious chicken and artichoke pizza made by hand with fresh ingredients.  The chicken wings were unbelievably good, and the high quality oil they use for them provided a wonderful crispness and flavor.  Best of all they deliver!

meQvr8o7OvRItLfnNUA06g.text: Brought a team of 14 hungry football players here for there post tournament dinner. Friendly service was only outdone by the great food. Stromboli was excellent and the pizza was awesome! Order half sizes unless you bring a monster appetite.

T50dbjv7JDng1iQBTWaq6Q.text: Owner is a real nice friendly guy.  Pizza was fresh and crust was crunchy  This place is a gem

iRVYp5QmMnQXu8Igk5wJrA.text: Fantastic place for pizza, calzones, meatball sandwich. We came here for lunch (thanks to yelp) and the rating defenatly matches their food. My kids fell in love with the garlic knots and could not get enough of their pizza as well. We will be coming back for sure.

3KnEQS8w9cWBTXHu1FAN1Q.text: Loved this place. We had a pepperoni and meat lover's and both were just fantastic. Best pizza's I've had in a long while. The garlic knots are fantastic as well. Hello to Bro. Biaggio and family from your new friends in West Jordan. Next time we are in Vegas, one of our stops will definitely be pizza and garlic knots.

9Egwb08Xalf__MGHSKhSiA.text: Amazing food! (ESP garlic knots)  Very friendly service & great pizza!!

XrWi8rEJ83S-EdiG5dGA8A.text: This place caught me by surprise. I was pretty skeptical because I have not had too many memorable pizza experiences here in Vegas but I will definitely give this place another try. We got 2 medium pizzas (cheese with onion and extra cheese and a supreme). We got our pizza delivered so it wasn't as crispy as I was hoping it would be but that is no one's fault in particular. And it took them a little under an hour to get it to the house. The price of the pizza is a little higher than what I am used to paying but it is supposedly hand tossed and it tasted good so, it was worth it. The crust was really good, just slightly crispy on the outside and the marinara was very nicely seasoned. The ingredients used don't taste cheap at all. It isn't the BEST pizza I've had in town but certainly better than a majority of the competition.

l2IdXyBK3Dgcr_8o54G-dw.text: Best prices and service in town, hands down.  We found Biaggio's through Yelp on our way back to town from our trip to Grand Canyon as we were craving pizza. Once we arrived to Biaggio's Pizzaria, we were welcomed with open arms as if we were family by Mr. Biaggio himself. Mr. Biaggio is one of the nicest restaurant owners you'll ever meet in your life and is not happy until his customers are satisfied and in my opinion, all restaurant owners should strive to follow in his footsteps.    I ordered 2 slices of pizza and a large soda for $6 which is the BEST deal in town. The sausage was very flavorful and the pizza was awesome overall, especially for the price.   I also tried the meatball and 'gravy' and that was probably the best meatballs I've had in my life, and I'm pretty picky with meatballs. The meatballs were so good, that I had to inquire details since they were so phenomenal. Mr. Biaggio informed us that the meatball and sauce is a family recipe and the bread is cooked fresh daily. So if you're going to Biaggio's, you MUST order a meatball sub if not on your first visit, then definitely your second.  5 stars all around, Biaggio's just gained some regular customers!.

Wz4f1X4tgJ3BG4mtwwhGdw.text: I tried Biaggio's for the first time tonight. It's in my neighborhood, the prices are competitive, and the reviews here were enough to make up my mind.  I placed a carryout order for a medium cheese pizza and a garden salad w/ ranch. Easy order, fine way to test the waters, and even if it's bad, it's good.  It took them longer than stated on the phone, no big deal, I waited for about 5 minutes in the restaurant. Biaggio introduced himself to me. Nice guy.  I get home, and the $5.50 garden salad was *tiny*. I think they incorrectly gave me a side salad. I called, spoke to Biaggio's son John, he asked what they could do to correct it and I told him it was not a probleml, I just wanted them to know. He was very polite and told me that the next meal was on the house.   Now, the food: The salad was fine. No complaints about quality. The pizza was fine too. It's hard to be objective about pizza. I didn't prefer their pizza, as I like a thinner crust and crispier texture. But there was nothing "wrong" with it. The flavor was good, and the blend of cheeses was nice as well.   I would advise others to try it. You can't beat the price, and the customer services was above average for Las Vegas. Pizza preference is subjective, so I can certainly see why so many others rave about Biaggio's.

C2wDtpdcaKE2tG3qZwuXyA.text: Loved this place. Finally made the trip after hearing all my friends rave about it. Sauce is incredible! No salt or sugar in the sauce makes it extra friendly. Pizza is to die for and the meatballs?? Forget about it! My new favorite place to eat!

1EVN1EiYAnjmA3HG_EvHwA.text: I honestly can't write long passages about good pizzas. There really isn't any bad pizza out there that I can't eat because  I can eat pizza hot, cold, soggy, crispy, salty, sweet, any way you name it.   In short, come here because Mr. Biaggio runs this join with his entire family and they deliver on their word. They will make things "5 Stars" for you and isn't that worth it in the end?   My wife ordered to-go here and the salad was excellent but they forgot to bring the diet coke. The delivery man said "OMG I'm so sorry, I forgot let me go get it for you." We insisted no, but he left anyways. An unsual 15 minutes later he shows up with a refreshing cold can of coke. He went to buy it at the next door restaurant. Now THAT'S FIRST CLASS SERVICE.

GxVA623et3wbz3ivjfcocg.text: I went to Biaggio's because of all the positive yelp reviews on here. . . they did not disdapoint.  They serve real pizza here.  We ordered the white pizza, it was awesome. The mozz was fresh and the ricotta was smooth and creamy. No one ingredient on the pizza was overpowering, a rarity in my opinion. The crust of thr pizza was perfect. PERFECT. It was thin, crispy but not burnt, and completely cooked. The crust was what really made the pizza and what will keep mr coming back.  The only reason I didnt rate it five stars was because the pizza had too much oil on it for me.
